Sec. 2-120 Fire Department Administration.
   a.   The Board of the Fire Department shall be the Chief of the Volunteer
Fire Department.
   b.   The Town Council, by appropriate ordinance, may establish those
positions it deems necessary to effectively and efficiently operate the
department.
Sec. 2-121 Uniform Allowance for Fire Department/EMT Members.
   a.   The Town of Schererville shall each year provide a uniform allowance to
all members of its Fire Department/EMT, who qualify for such allowance, or
provide uniforms, and/or equipment equivalent to one thousand three hundred
thirty-nine ($1,339.00) dollars per year.
   b.   This allowance or provision of uniforms and/or equipment shall be
provided in four (4) equal installments, the dates of same being March 31st,
June 30th, September 30th and December 31st of each year.
(Ord. No. 1334, §§ 1-2, 4-10-96; Ord. No. 1452C, 5-9-07)
Sec. 2-122 Wages and Compensation.
   The annual salaries of the sworn members of the Fire Department shall be set
by annual ordinance of the Town Council.
Sec. 2-123 Powers and Duties in General.
   The public safety regulations enforced by the Fire Department are set forth
in
Chapter 6 of this Code, and Building Regulations enforced by the Fire
Department are set forth in
Chapter 7 of this Code.
Sec. 2-124 Definitions.
   The following definitions shall apply throughout this division, as the same
may be amended from time to time, namely:
   a.   Chief - The Chief of the Town of Schererville Fire Department, or his
designee, unless context clearly indicates otherwise;
   b.   Fire Department - Collectively, all members of the Town of Schererville
Fire Department, unless context clearly indicates otherwise;
   c.   Local Board - The Fire Pension Board of the Town of Schererville;
   d.   Local Standards or Standards - Standards developed by the Local Board
for establishing a passing grade or score on the agility, mental and physical
examination required by Indiana Code, § 36-8-3.2, et seq., as amended from time
to time, for admission to the Firefighters' Public Employees Retirement Fund;
   e.   Member of the Fire Department, Active Member, or Member - A full-time,
paid employee of the Town of Schererville Fire Department, including the Chief;
   f.   Perf - The Public Employee Retirement Fund established pursuant to
Indiana Code, § 5-10-3.1, et seq., as amended from time to time;
   g.   Trustee - Any person elected to a position on the Fire Pension Board
described in Section
2-125, and who is elected pursuant to the procedures contained within Sections
2-127,
2-128, or
2-129.
(Ord. No. 1541, § 1, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-125 Fire Pension Board Established; Duties.
   a.   There is hereby established in the Town of Schererville a Fire Pension
Board, which Local Board shall perform the following duties, namely:
      1.   Establish the standards for passing the physical agility test,
general aptitude test, and physical examination required for admission of a new
employee to PERF;
      2.   Certify to PERF that an applicant for employment has passed those
examinations listed in subsection (a) above;
      3.   Determine whether member(s) of the Fire Department are entitled to a
leave of absence for purposes of disability;
      4.   Determine whether a member has a covered impairment as defined by
Indiana Code, § 36-8-8-12.3, as amended from time to time, which makes the
member unable, either temporarily or permanently, to perform the member's
duties with the Fire Department;
      5.   Hear and determine all applications for relief or pensions;
      6.   Make all rules necessary for the discharge of its duties; and
      7.   All other duties imposed upon the Local Board by applicable law.
(Ord. No. 1541, § 2, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-126 Trustees.
   The Trustees of the Local Board shall be as follows:
   a.   The Town Council President and the Chief, who shall be ex-officio
members, and shall be entitled to vote on any matter, and shall be counted
towards a quorum at any meeting;
   b.   When there are three (3) or more retired members of the Fire
Department, one (1) Trustee shall be elected for a two (2) year term from among
those retired members, in accordance with Section
2-129; and
   c.   Four (4) active members of the Fire Department who shall each be
elected to four (4) year terms, in accordance with Section
2-128.
(Ord. No. 1541, § 3, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-127 Election of Trustees; Initial.
   a.   The first election of the Fire Department Member Trustees shall be held
within sixty (60) days of the effective date of this Division. The Chief shall
post a notice in one (1) or more prominent locations at a designated Fire
Station setting the date, time and place of the meeting to nominate candidates
and elect Trustees of the Local Board. Such notice shall be posted at least
forty-eight (48) hours in advance of the scheduled meeting.
   b.   At said scheduled meeting, the Members of the Fire Department shill
nominate candidates from among their membership for election to the Local
Board. Immediately thereafter, the Members shall vote for four (4) candidates;
the four (4) candidates with the most votes shall serve as Trustees of the
Local Board.
   c.   The Trustees so elected shall serve staggered terms of one (1), two
(2), three (3) and four (4) years. A Member's assignment to a particular term
shall be determined by lot.
(Ord. No. 1541, § 4, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-128 Election of Trustees; Active Members.
   a.   An election shall be held on the second Monday in February every year
after the establishment of the Local Board to elect one (1) Trustee from the
active members of the Fire Department for a term of four (4) years commencing
on the day of his or her election. The Chief shall fix a time for holding a
convention to nominate candidates for Trustees to be elected at each election.
Each convention must be held at least five (5) days before the day on which the
annual election is held, and the notice fixing the time and date of the
convention must be posted at least five (5) days in advance of the convention.
A convention consists of one (1) delegate selected from the Fire Department,
and one (1) delegate who shall be selected by the Chief and his/her Assistants.
The delegate from the Fire Department shall be elected by ballot by the Members
of the department at a time to be fixed by the Chief in the call for a
convention. The election of delegates shall be certified by the Chief or other
Officer of the department, or, if there is not an Officer present, then by the
oldest member of the department present. The convention, when assembled, shall
nominate four (4) members of the Fire Department to be voted upon as Trustees,
and the delegates shall report the names of the persons nominated as candidates
to the Chief in writing.
   b.   The election shall be held at the Fire Station between 9:00 a.m. and 6:
00 p.m. on the second Monday of each February. Votes shall be cast by secret
ballot. Each member of the Fire Department is entitled to one (1) ballot, and
the ballot may not contain the names of more than one (1) candidate chosen from
the six (6) persons nominated by the convention. The candidate receiving the
highest number of votes is elected.
   c.   The Chief or other Officer in command of the Fire Department,
immediately after the casting of the ballots, shall canvass and count the
ballots. He or she shall certify, in writing, the total number of ballots cast
and the number of votes received by each candidate for the Office of Trustee.
After signing the certification, the Officer shall enclose it, together with
all the ballots cast by the Fire Department, in an envelope, securely sealed
and addressed, and deliver them to the Chief. The Chief shall deliver them to
the Town Council President as soon as all certificates and ballots have been
received by him or her. Upon receipt, the Town Council President shall, in the
presence of the Chief and the Clerk-Treasurer, open the envelopes, examine the
certificates, and determine the total number of votes cast for each of the
candidates. The Town Council President shall then issue a certificate of
election to the candidate having received the highest number of votes. If two
(2) or more candidates have received the same number of votes, the Town Council
President and the Chief shall immediately determine by lot who will be Trustee
from the persons who received such equal number of votes.
   d.   An election may not be set aside for lack of formality in balloting by
the members or for lack of formality in certifying of transmitting the returns
of an election by the Officers in charge.
(Ord. No. 1541, § 5, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-129 Election of Trustees; Retired Members.
   a.   An election shall be held every two (2) years to elect one (1) Trustee
from the retired members of the Fire Department for a term of two (2) years,
commencing on the day of his or her election, if the list of retired members
contains three (3) or more persons at the time of the election. The Chief shall
fix a time for holding a convention to nominate candidates for Trustee to be
elected at each election. Each convention must be held at least fifteen (15)
days before the day on which the biennial election is held. All retired members
of the Fire Department may participate in the convention. The convention, when
assembled, shall nominate not more than four (4) members of the retired list to
be voted upon as Trustee. The Secretary of the Local Board shall mail the names
of the persons nominated, along with an official ballot, to the retired members
within forty-eight (48) hours of the end of the convention.
   b.   The election shall be conducted by mail. Each retired member is
entitled to cast one (1) ballot by mail, and that ballot may not contain more
than one (1) name, chosen from the list of retired persons nominated by the
convention. The candidate receiving the highest number of votes by 6:00 p.m. on
the second Monday in February, or an alternative date in February specified in
the bylaws of the Firefighters' Pension Fund, is elected.
   c.   The ballots must remain closed and inviolate until the close of the
election, at which time, in the presence of the Town Council President, the
Chief and the Clerk-Treasurer, the ballots shall be opened and counted. A
certificate of election shall be issued to the candidate receiving the highest
number of votes. If two (2) or more candidates receive the same number of
votes, the Town Council President and the Chief shall immediately determine by
lot who will be Trustee from the persons receiving such an equal number of
votes.
(Ord. 1541, § 6, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-130 Officers; Adoption of Rules; Quorum; Proceedings.
   a.   The Chief shall be President of the Local Board. After the first
meeting, the Trustees shall elect a Secretary, who may be elected from among
the Trustees or, in the alternative, the Trustees may consider it proper to
have a member of the Fire Department to serve as a Secretary, in which case,
the Secretary shall serve for a term of four (4) years and shall be elected in
the same manner as Trustees. The Secretary shall keep a full record of the
proceedings of the Local Board in a book designated, kept and maintained for
that purpose.
   b.   A majority of the Local Board shall constitute a quorum for any action.
   c.   A majority vote of all Trustees shall be sufficient to take any action
which the Local Board may take.
(Ord. 1541, § 7, 10-17-01)
Sec. 2-131 through Sec. 2-133 Reserved for Future Use.
Division VI. Public Works Department.
Sec. 2-134 Division of the Public Works Department.
   Public Works is composed of the following:
   a.   Streets and Sanitation headed by a Supervisor;
   b.   Equipment Maintenance;
   c.   Sewer/Water Transmission Division headed by a Superintendent;
   d.   Sewerage Treatment Division headed by a Sewer Treatment and Water
Quality Superintendent.
Sec. 2-135 Public Works Director.
   The position of Public Works Director of the Town of Schererville, Lake
County, Indiana, is created.
(Ord. No. 769, § 1, 12-27-78; Schererville Town Code, § 2-10-1)
Sec. 2-136 Terms of Employment of Public Works Director.  26
   The Public Works Director of the Town of Schererville, Lake County, Indiana,
shall serve at the pleasure of the Town Manager of the Town of Schererville,
Lake County, Indiana, and the employment of the Public Works Director shall
always be terminable with or cause. The salary of the Public Works Director
shall be as fixed by the Town Council in the Town's annual budget or as
authorized from other revenues of the town and all other terms and conditions
of employment, including benefits and payment of dues, shall be as fixed and
agreed to by the Town Council from time to time.
 
Notes
26    Editor's Note: This section was amended at the request of the Town during
   its recodification process.
Sec. 2-137 Powers and Duties.  27
   Unless a subsequent written ordinance of the Town of Schererville or a
written order of the Town Council of said Town directs to the contrary, the
Public Works Director shall have the following duties, responsibilities, powers
and authority:
   1.   He shall be responsible for issuing all Public Works permits and
approving all applications that are required by the Town.
(Ord. No. 769, § 3, ¶1-8, 12-27-78; Schererville Town Code, § 2-10-94)
      All applications or requests for a permit of whatsoever nature and
purpose require by said Town shall be submitted to the Planning and Building
Administrator for filing and review and then to the Public Works Director. Such
applications and permits shall include, but are not limited to the following:
      a.   Permits and applications relating in any manner to streets,
utilities, water, sewers, and sanitation. Upon the filing of said application
or request, the Planning and Building Administrator shall immediately forward
such request or application to the Director of Public Works or secretary of the
proper Town body for consideration. The proper official or Town body shall
review the request and determine whether the application or request should be
approved or rejected and, if approved, what conditions, if any, should attach
to that approval.
      b.   The Public Works Director shall oversee the proper fee to be paid to
the Town for such application or request and upon payment of the proper fee to
the Town Clerk-Treasurer and satisfaction of all conditions attached to said
approval, if any, the Public Works Director shall issue the appropriate permit.
The Public Works Director may delegate his power to review, act upon and issue
any particular type of permit to any official or appropriate employee of the
Town of Schererville, Indiana, which official or employee shall have the
authority and power to act upon all permits of that type to the extent
designated the Public Works Director.
(Ord. No. 770, 12-27-78; Schererville Town Code, § 2-10-4, ¶ 8)
   2.   He shall review and make recommendations on all plans, specifications,
and other engineering data of or pertaining to any of the Town's services.
   3.   He shall be responsible for all special public works related projects.
   4.   He shall have access to all Town records and files, with the exception
of personnel records of individuals not directly under his control.
   5.   He shall be responsible for public relations and news releases for all
public works related items, with the exception of those items which the Town
Council desires to handle itself.
(Ord. No. 769, § 3, ¶8, 9, 16, 18, 19, 12-27-78)
 
Notes
      Editor's Note: Provisions of Ord. No. 769, § 3, which was passed on
27 December 27, 1978 were re-distributed to the Town Administrator and Planning
   and Building Administrator at the request of the Town during the
   recodification process.
Sec. 2-138 Extent of Services.
   During his term of employment, the Public Works Director shall devote his
full time to his employment and shall not undertake any activity which would be
in conflict with his employment as Public Works Director or inimical to the
best interest of the Town.
   During the terms of his employment, the Public Works Director shall not
engage in any other business activity, whether or not such business activity is
pursued for gain, profit or other pecuniary advantage, without the express
written approval of the Town.
(Ord. No. 769, § 4, 12-27-78; Schererville Town Code, § 2-10-4)
Sec. 2-139 Vacancy.  28
   a.   When a vacancy occurs in the position of Public Works Director, or when
the Town Manager receives notice that a vacancy shall occur in said position,
the Town Manager shall take whatever action it deems necessary and appropriate
to fill such position. If, however, the Town Manager of the Town deems it in
the best interest of the Town to leave said position vacant for whatever period
of time it deems advisable and in the best interest of the Town, nothing
contained herein shall require the appointment of a new Public Works Director
to immediately fill such vacancy.
   b.   If a conflict arises between any of these provisions and its Personnel
Policy, the Personnel Policy shall prevail.

Sec. 2-150 Planning and Building Department.  29
   a.   The Planning and Building Department shall be headed by a Planning and

addressed in state and local laws.

permits shall include, but are not limited to, the following:

      2.   Plumbing permit
      3.   Change of use permit
      4.   Zone permit
      5.   Building permit
      6.   Issuance of certificate of occupancy
      7.   Zone change applications
      8.   Subdivision applications
      9.   Special exception applications
      10.   Variance applications
      11.   Contractor's licensing
      12.   Street excavation
      13.   Permits and applications relating in any manner to streets,
utilities, water, sewers, and sanitation. Upon filing of said application or
request, the Planning and Building Department shall immediately forward such
request or application to the proper official or secretary to the proper Town
body for consideration. The proper official or Town body shall review the
request and determine whether the application or request should be approved or
rejected and, if approved, what conditions, if any, should attach to that
approval.
(Ord. No. 769, § 3, 12-27-78)
   d.   Building regulations are set forth in
Chapter 7 of this Code and Zoning regulations are set forth in
Chapter 10 of this Code.

Division II. Town Recording Secretaries.
Sec. 2-172 Town Recording Secretaries.
   a.   The Schererville Town Council finds it necessary to create the new
position of Town Recording Secretary in order to better facilitate the timely
recording and transcribing of all Town official minutes and meetings as herein
described.
   b.   Town Recording Secretaries shall be hired by the Town Council and shall
work exclusively under the direct guidance, supervision and direction of the
Town Council and the Town Manager.
   c.   The chief duties and responsibilities of Town Recording Secretaries
shall include but not be limited to the recording and transcribing of detailed
and accurate minutes of all public Town meetings and hearings including:
      1.   Plan Commission meetings.
      2.   Board of Zoning Appeals meetings.
and such other official Town meetings as requested by the Town Manager.
   d.   The Town Recording Secretaries shall tape, record, and transcribe all
minutes of public hearings and meetings herein described and shall then provide
the Town Council a final typed copy within twenty (20) days after each of the
aforesaid public hearings and meetings.
   e.   The Town Recording Secretaries shall deliver the tape or tapes in
addition to the original transcript containing the recorded public hearing or
meeting to the Clerk-Treasurer upon completion of said transcript. Said tape or
tapes shall be kept on file for a period of no less than one (1) year by the
Clerk-Treasurer. The official transcript shall be made a part of the Clerk-
Treasurer's permanent records.
   f.   The Town Recording Secretaries shall have the employment status of a
regular part-time employee and shall be compensated at the hourly rate as so
specified in the Town's Salary Ordinance, and shall also receive all Town
benefits as outlined in the Town°s Personnel Policy, set forth in Section
2-300 et seq., of this Code.
(Ord. No. 580, 3-11-81)
Sec. 2-173 Reserved for Future Use.

Sec. 2-175 Alcohol and Substance Abuse Policy and Testing Procedure
Incorporated by Reference.
   a.   The Alcohol and Substance Abuse Policy and Testing Procedure drafted by
the Safety Committee of the Town of Schererville and incorporated herein by
reference.
(Ord. No. 1226A, § 1, 5-8-96)
   b.   Any and all provisions in conflict with the terms and conditions of
said Alcohol and Substance Abuse Policy and Testing Procedure, particularly
paragraph C(3) of Section 10.6 of the Personnel Policy are deleted and
repealed.
(Ord. No. 1266A, § 2, 5-8-96)
   c.   The Town of Schererville, Lake County, Indiana, Alcohol and Drug Abuse
Policy and Testing Procedure is amended as follows:
DISCIPLINARY ACTION
   If an employee tests positive for drugs or alcohol, that employee shall be
suspended for a minimum of five (5) days. Thereafter, the employee will not
return to work until they successfully pass a drug or alcohol test. The
particular test to which the employee must submit v/ill be for the substance
upon which they originally tested positive. It shall be the responsibility of
the Town Manager to make a determination as to the appropriate discipline for
an employee who tests positive for either drug or alcohol use. The five (5) day
minimum suspension is mandatory, however, the mere fact that an employee passes
a drug or alcohol test, whichever applies in this particular situation, does
not mandate his/her return to employment. This is a decision which will be made
by the Town Manager.
   If an employee is not terminated upon the first positive test for drugs or
alcohol, upon a second positive test within a twenty-four (24) month period of
time, the employee shall be terminated immediately.
   A person who tests positive on an alcohol or drug test, is obligated to sign
a contract with a state-certified Substance Abuse Professional (SAP). The
employee must agree to complete a program recommended by the (SAP), and
furthermore, they are to be randomly tested a minimum of six (6) times during
the twelve (12) months following their positive test. If more than six (6)
tests are deemed necessary by the drug or alcohol counselor, then the employee
must submit to whatever random tests are deemed necessary.
   Failure to comply with the aftercare program shall result in immediate
termination.
   d.   All other non-conflicting provisions of the Town of Schererville, Lake
County, Indiana, Alcohol and Drug Abuse Policy and Testing Procedure shall
remain in full force and effect.
(Ord. No. 1266B, § § 1,2, 4-9-97)

(Ord. No. 1448, § 1, 3-10-99)

Sec. 2-177 Credit Card Regulations.
   a.   That the Town Council of the Town of Schererville, Lake County,
Indiana, hereby authorizes the use of Town of Schererville-issued credit cards
by employees, including sworn police officers and elected officials as set
forth hereinafter, as needed, under the approval authorization of the Town
Clerk-Treasurer and Town Manager. The usage of Town of Schererville-issued
credit cards will be the responsibility of each of the Town Clerk-Treasurer and
Town Manager to administer. For all credit card usage by town employees and
sworn police officers, as well as elected officials, the chain of communication
and approval authorization shall be through the Department Heads of each of the
responsible Departments of the Town as specified under the current approved
policies and procedures for credit card usage. The Department Heads will be
responsible for the processing of credit card usage and activities, and upon
such review and handling by the Department Heads, detailed and documentary
report and information will be provided to the Town Clerk-Treasurer and Town
Manager by said responsible Department Head(s). (Ord. 1934, § 2, 1-16-2019)
   b.   The policies and procedures established herein shall be directly
administered by the Town Clerk-Treasurer. The rules, regulations, and policies
established hereby shall be supplemental to and in addition to all rules,
regulations, policies and laws promulgated by the State of Indiana or the
Indiana State Board of Accounts for such policies and procedures. Whenever
there is conflict in the policies and procedures established hereby or in any
amendatory ordinance with the rules, regulations, policies and laws of the
State of Indiana or the State Board of Accounts, said State of Indiana and
State Board of Accounts rules, regulations, policies and applicable laws shall
supersede and govern. (Ord. 1934, § 3, 1-16-2019)
   c.   That Schererville town-issued credit cards are issued subject to the
guidelines heretofore established by the Clerk-Treasurer's Office, which shall
include, but are not necessarily limited to, the following:
      1.   The issuance and monitoring of the use of said credit cards are
hereby delegated to the Clerk-Treasurer, or his/her duly authorized agent.
      2.   All purchases are to be supported with valid and appropriate
itemized receipt(s).
      3.   Standard operating procedures and internal controls for the credit
card system, as amended from time to time, are available from the Clerk-
Treasurer's Office.
      4.   Credit card purchases shall not be used to circumvent the town
purchasing system.
      5.   Allowable use of the credit card shall include, but shall not be
limited to, travel, small purchases, and online purchases, all as appropriately
approved.
      6.   Unacceptable purchases shall include, but are not limited to,
personal transactions, unapproved transactions, and alcohol. (Ord. 1934, § 4,
1-16-2019)
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer is directed and authorized hereby to establish and
implement standard operating procedures and internal controls for the credit
card usage program and system, as amended from time to time, in the Town of
Schererville, The current Standard Operating Procedure for credit card usage/
ordering is attached to Ord. 1934 as Exhibit “A”, incorporated herein by
reference as if laid out in full. A copy of said Standard Operating Procedure
for credit card usage in the Town of Schererville is available from the Office
of the Town Clerk-Treasurer. The Clerk-Treasurer is hereby directed to copy
each Town Department Head, who in turn is directed to copy each Employee with
acknowledgment of receipt document processing to be followed, to be filed in
each town employee file. (Ord. 1934, § 5, 1-16-2019)
   e.   The town employees and officials who are authorized to use a town-
issued credit card will be required to sign an agreement, as amended from time
to time. At the time of the initial issuance of the credit card, the cardholder
will be provided a copy of the signed agreement along with a copy of this
ordinance, or any amendments hereto. A copy of the signed agreement shall be
filed in the Town Clerk-Treasurer's Office. (Ord. 1934, § 6, 1-16-2019)
   f.   For violation of the credit card usage regulations established hereby,
immediate termination of use and privilege of Town of Schererville-issued
credit cards may occur. Further, violation may also subject the violating
individual(s) to discipline consistent with the then-existing Town Personnel
Policy disciplinary provisions, or any other then-applicable law. (Ord. 1934, §
7, 1-16- 2019)
Sec. 2-178 Clothing Allowance for Police Department and Fire Department

   All civilian employees of the Town of Schererville Police Department and

(Ord. No. 1334, § 7, 4-10-96; Ord. No. 1334B, § 1, 11-8-00)
Sec. 2-179 Reserved for Future Use.
Sec. 2-180 Town Travel Policy.
   a.   Registration Fees. The cost of registration or similar fees for
conferences, seminars and other similar meetings or functions related to Town
affairs will be provided for or reimbursed with proper documentation and shall
include any detailed conference agendas. The approval process policy of the
Town for attendance at such business events, meetings, and functions will be
followed, including specific approval authorization and claim docket processing
arrangements for these affairs, which shall be made by a designated person
using the Town credit card, or by billing the individual directly. All
reimbursements must be requested and submitted and documented by original
itemized receipts.
   b.   Transportation.
      1.   Travel by commercial airlines, rail service, bus, or rideshare will
be provided for at the prevailing “coach” or “tourist” rate when authorized and
supported by itemized receipts.
      2.   Taxi fare and/or the cost of other local rideshare services will be
provided for or reimbursed when supported by original itemized receipts.
      3.   Parking fees and tolls will be reimbursed when supported by original
itemized receipts.
      4.   The use of personal automobiles for Town Travel is permitted and
will be reimbursed at the maximum IRS rate for personal automobile/vehicle use
provided the travel has been authorized by the employee's immediate supervisor
and the proper mileage claims have been submitted.
      5.   The use of personal automobiles for Town Travel is permitted and
will be reimbursed at the maximum IRS rate for personal automobile/vehicle use
provided the travel has been authorized by the employee's immediate supervisor
and that the proper mileage claims have been submitted.
   c.   Lodging.
      1.   Lodging shall be provided for or reimbursed when supported by
original itemized receipts in the following manner, and as approved at the
direction of the Department Head:
         A.   Single occupancy will be provided at the actual cost.
         B.   Double occupancy will be provided at actual cost when both
parties are eligible for reimbursement.
         C.   Double occupancy will be provided at the single occupancy rate
when only one party is eligible for reimbursement unless room is a one rate
charge.
      2.   If using a personal credit card, reimbursement for lodging costs
shall include room costs and associated local taxes. Any other charges made to
the room are the responsibility of the Town Official.
      3.   Every Town Official is required to supply a current Sales Tax-Exempt
Form (ST-105) to the lodging provider.
   d.   Meals.
      1.   Definitions
         MEAL- any of the regular occasions in a day when a reasonably large
amount of food is eaten such as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Alcohol shall not
be reimbursed.
         GRATUITY - based on meal and non-alcoholic beverage subtotal only- tax
not included.
      2.   Any Town Official that is on official Town business, and the
business portion of the trip is longer than a ten (10) hour period, including
travel time, shall be allowed up to Thirty Dollars ($30.00) per day for a meal,
excluding gratuity [not to exceed twenty percent (20%)]. A Town Official shall
be reimbursed for the meal if a) the Town Official uses a personal credit card;
or b) the Town Official pays with cash. In both instances the Town Official is
required to submit an original itemized receipt.
      3.   Any Town Official that is on official Town business, and the trip
involves an overnight stay, shall be allowed up to Sixty Dollars ($60.00), per
day, not including gratuity, for meals. Gratuities should be reasonable but
shall not exceed twenty percent (20%). Meals purchased using a personal credit
card or cash will be reimbursed when supported by an original itemized receipt.
      4.   When separate checks are not available and a Town Official pays for
other Town Officials, the names of all attending the meal shall be written on
the back of the receipt. Each eligible Town Official shall be allowed the
amount indicated in 2. or 3. The Town Official shall be reimbursed for the
meals if a) the Town Official uses a personal credit card; or b) the Town
Official pays with cash. In both instances the Town Official is required to
submit an original itemized receipt.
      5.   No reimbursement will be made for meals when already provided for in
the registration fee.
(Ord. No. 1515, § 2, 3-14-01; Ord. No. 1995, § 3, 10-11-23)
Sec. 2-181 Cellular Telephone Usage Policy.
   a.   The Town may provide cellular telephones and rate plans/packages for
designated Town employees and officials in order for the duly designated Town
employees and officials to effectively perform their assigned duties and
responsibilities. The designation of the Town employees for whom such cellular
phones are provided is at the direction and authorization of the Town Manager.
   b.   The use of Town-issued cellular telephones is authorized for
communications related to the function and purpose of the Town and in
connection with the performance of assigned duties and responsibilities by the
duly designated Town employees and officials thereof.
   c.   Town employees and officials who are issued cellular telephones and who
incur roaming charges or exceed the minutes provided under the rate plan/
package amount for personal calls (those not related to Town business) will
reimburse the Town for the amount of the additional charges.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer shall maintain a log of Town employees and
officials issued Town cellular telephones, including the following information:
      1.   an identification number or description, and the phone number of the
Town-owned cellular telephone;
      2.   the name and title/position of each Town employee or official to
whom a cellular telephone has been issued; and
      3.   the Town business use for said cellular telephone.
   e.   Any Town employee determined to have violated this cellular telephone
usage policy will be deemed to have committed a Group I Violation as set forth
in the Town Personnel Policy Manual for Employees, and will be subject to the
provisions of same, including the loss of use of the privilege and possession
of a Town-issued cellular telephone.
(Ord. No. 1608, §§ 1-5, 3-10-04; Ord. No. 1608A, § 1, 8-11-04)
Sec. 2-182 Nepotism Policy.
   a.   That the Town Council now finds that it is required, necessary and
appropriate to adopt a policy of conduct with regard to nepotism in employment
with the Town of Schererville, as well as in contracting with the Town of
Schererville, in order to continue to provide local government services to the
residents of the town, as well as to comply with the new laws effective July 1,
2012, specified and set forth in the provisions of I.C. § 36-1-20.2 and I.C. §
36-1-21, respectively.
   b.   That the provisions of this section shall be become effective for the
Town of Schererville July 1, 2012, and whereby the Town of Schererville shall
establish hereby a Nepotism Policy and a Contracting with a Unit Policy, that
complies with the minimum requirements of I.C. § 36-1-20.2 (hereinafter
"Nepotism Policy"), as well as I.C. § 36-1-21 (hereinafter "Contracting with
the Unit by a Relative Policy"). The Town Council further decrees hereby that
implementation of each of the Nepotism Policy and Contracting with a Unit by a
Relative Policy will become effective and whereby implementation will commence
instanter on July 1,2012.
   c.   That the Nepotism Policy of the Town of Schererville is hereby
established effective July 1, 2012, by adoption of the minimum requirement
provisions of I.C. § 36-1-20.2, as the same currently exists, may be
supplemented or amended thereto in the future, and as same exists hereafter.
Such current minimum requirement provisions of I.C. § 36-1-20.2, and as such
are supplemented or amended thereafter and as same is law in the State of
Indiana hereafter from time to time, are made a part hereof and incorporated
herein as though fully set forth and incorporated herein. Further, a copy of
the provisions of I.C. § 36-1-20.2, entitled Nepotism, in effect July 1, 2012,
is attached hereto.
   d.   That the contracting with a Unit by a Relative Policy of the Town of
Schererville is hereby established effective July 1, 2012, by adoption of the
minimum requirement provisions of I.C. § 36-1-21, as the same currently exists,
may be supplemented or amended thereto in the future, and as same exists
hereafter. Such current minimum requirement provisions of I.C. § 36-1-21, and
as such are supplemented or amended thereafter and as same is law in the State
of Indiana hereafter from time to time, are made a part hereof and incorporated
herein as though fully set forth and incorporated herein. Further, a copy of
the provisions of I.C. § 36-1-21, entitled Contracting with a Unit by a
Relative Policy, in effect July 1, 2012, is attached hereto.
   e.   That the Town Council hereby acknowledges and concurs that each of the
provisions of I.C. § 36-1-20.2 arid I.C. § 36-1-21 specifically permit a unit
of local government such as the Town of Schererville to adopt requirements that
are "more stringent or detailed", and that the Town Council hereby finds that
more details are necessary and appropriate.
   f.   That the Town Council further finds and declares that a single Member
of the Town Council, as Legislative Body, shall not act for the Town Council to
make or issue work assignments, compensation, grievances, advancement or a
performance evaluation without prior authority of a majority of the entire Town
Council, and therefore, without such authority by the majority, such individual
Town Council Member will not be in the direct line of supervision, (please note
the provisions of I.C. § 36-4-6-11 and I.C. § 36-5-2-9.4).
   g.   That the Town of Schererville further finds and declares that a single
member of governing bodies with authority over employees in the town shall not
act for said governing bodies to make or issue work assignments, compensation,
grievances, advancement or a performance evaluation without prior authority of
a majority of the responsible governing body, when a statute provides the
majority is needed to act, and therefore, without such authority by the
majority of said governing body, the single member will not be in the direct
line of supervision.
   h.   That all elected and appointed officials and employees of the Town of
Schererville are directed and required to cooperate fully in the implementation
of the policies established by this section, and in demonstrating compliance
with these same policies. The policies established hereby shall be incorporated
by reference in the Town Personnel Policy Manual, as the same is amended from
time to time, as well as in the Town Ethics Regulations Policy Ordinance, as
same is amended from time to time.
   i.   That failure to abide by or cooperate with the implementation,
compliance and certifications connected with the Nepotism Policy is a violation
of this section, as same may be amended from time to time, and may result in
the discipline, including termination, of an employee or transfer from the
direct line of supervision or other curative action. Any elected or appointed
Official of the Town of Schererville who fails to abide by or cooperate with
the implementation, compliance and/or mandated certification submission of
either the Nepotism Policy or the contracting with a unit by a Relative Policy
may be subject to sanctions, penalties or legal procedures and actions in
conformance with by applicable law.
   j.   That the policies established and adopted by this section are hereby
directed to be implemented by any of the following, namely:
      1.   Posting a copy of this section in its entirety in at least one (1)
of the locations in the Town that posts employer posters or other notices to
its employees;
      2.   Providing a copy of this section to each of its employees and
elected and appointed officials, requesting from each distributee an
acknowledgment of receipt of same and filing/depositing of such acknowledgment
in the personnel employment file of each said employee, or elected and
appointed official;
      3.   Providing or posting a Notice of the Adoption of this section in any
other manner deemed appropriate;
      4.   By any such other action or actions that would communicate the
policies established by this section to the town employees and elected and
appointed officials.
      Upon any of the aforesaid actions being made, the policies established
hereby are deemed implemented by the Town of Schererville, Lake County,
Indiana. The Town Manager and Town Clerk-Treasurer are additionally directed to
report the implementation actions to the Town Council in its regular public
meeting in July, 2012, for the public record and report to the Town Council of
such.
   k.   That a copy of the provisions of I.C. § 36-1-20.2 and I.C. § 36-1-21,
effective July 1, 2012, are annexed hereto, incorporated herein and made a part
hereof.
   l.   That two (2) copies of I.C. § 36-1-20.2 and I.C. § 36-1-21, as
supplemented or amended, are on file in the Office of the Clerk-Treasurer of
the town for inspection as maybe required and requested by the provisions of
I.C. § 36-1-5-4.
   m.   That all existing ordinances and Town Code provisions, or portions
thereof, in conflict with the provisions of this section are hereby deemed
null, void, and of no legal effect, and are specifically repealed.
   n.   If any section, clause, provision or portion of this section shall be
held to be invalid or unconstitutional by any Court of competent jurisdiction,
such decision shall not affect any other section, clause, provision or portion
of this section.
(Ord. No. 1812, §§ 1-14, passed 6-13-12)
Sec. 2-183 through Sec. 2-209 Reserved for Future Use.
Article 7. Boards and Commissions.
Division I. Plan Commission and Board of Zoning Appeals.  35
 
Notes
35    I.C., § 36-7-4-201, et seq., addresses planning and zoning.
Sec. 2-210 Plan Commission Created.  36
   There is established a Plan Commission for the Town of Schererville,
Indiana, to consist of seven (7) members. The Town Council shall appoint three
(3) persons in the Town government as members. The President of the Town
Council shall appoint four (4) citizen members of the Town of whom not more
than two (2) may be of the same political party.
(Ord. No. 751; Schererville Town Code, § 2-13-1)
 
Notes
36    Editor's Note: Ord. No. 215, passed March 14, 1951, initially created the
   Plan Commission, and was subsequently amended by Ord. No. 751.
Sec. 2-211 Terms of Citizen Members.
   Two (2) citizen members of the Plan Commission shall be appointed for a term
of three (3) years and two (2) citizen members shall initially be appointed for
a term of four (4) years. When an initial term of office of a citizen member
expires, each new appointment of a citizen member shall be for a term of four
(4) years. The term of each citizen member of the Plan Commission shall expire
on the first Monday of January of the third of fourth year, as the case may be,
after the year of the member's appointment.
(Ord. No. 751; Schererville Town Code, § 2-13-2)
Sec. 2-212 Terms of Government Members.
   A government member of the Plan Commission shall serve a term which is
coextensive with the member's term of government office unless the Town
Council, at its first regular meeting in any year, appoints another government
member as a replacement.
(Ord. No. 751; Schererville Town Code, § 2-13-3)
Sec. 2-213 Vacancies.
   If any vacancy occurs among the citizen members of the Plan Commission, the
President of the Town Council shall appoint a member for the unexpired term of
the vacating member. The Town Council shall fill any vacancy occurring among
government members of the Plan Commission by appointing another government
member for the remainder of his elective term.
(Ord. No. 751; Schererville Town Code, § 2-13-4)
Sec. 2-214 Powers and Duties.
   The Plan Commission shall perform all of the duties and responsibilities
required of advisory municipal planning commissions by the statutes of the
state of Indiana as well as those duties and responsibilities assigned to it by
written order or ordinance of the Town Council. The Plan Commission shall have
full and exclusive power to make rules and regulations for its proper
management and may appoint and prescribe the duties of a secretary and such
employees as the duties and responsibilities of the Commission.
(Ord. No. 751; Schererville Town Code; § 2-13-5)
Sec. 2-215 Compensation.
   Each member of the Plan Commission of the Town of Schererville, Indiana
shall receive a salary as set by ordinance. The Plan Commission Attorney shall
be paid at a rate established by ordinance of the Town Council.
(Ord. No. 751; Schererville Town Code, § 2-13-6)
Sec. 2-216 Zoning Regulations.
   Zoning Regulations are set forth in
Chapter 10 of this Code.
Sec. 2-217 Board of Zoning Appeals.  37
   a.   A Board of Zoning Appeals is established to carry out the powers and
duties assigned to it by law.
   b.   Salaries of Board members may be established by proper ordinance of the
Town Council.
 
Notes
37    I.C., § 36-7-4-900, et seq., addresses the Board of Zoning Appeals.
Sec. 2-218 through Sec. 2-223 Reserved for Future Use.
Division II. Economic Development Commission.
Sec. 2-224 Establishment.
   The Town Council hereby finds it necessary to finance economic development
in the Town of Schererville, and as a consequence thereof, pursuant to the
provisions of I.C. § 36-7-12-4, as amended, hereby establishes a Department of
Economic Development for the Town of Schererville, to be controlled by a
Commission known as "The Town of Schererville Economic Development Commission".
The Town Council further deems it necessary to re-establish a Department of
Economic Development to be controlled by the Schererville Economic Development
Commission as a consequence of its determination that it has become necessary
to finance economic development to promote a substantial likelihood of creating
or retaining opportunities for gainful employment and creating business
opportunities, as well as for all other statutory purposes.
(Ord. No. 1723, § 2, 1-17-08)
Sec. 2-225 Membership.
   a.   Members of the Schererville Economic Development Commission shall be
appointed as follows, namely:
      1.   One (1) of the members shall be selected by the Town Executive;
      2.   One (1) of the members shall be nominated by the Fiscal Body of Lake
County (i.e. Lake County Council); and
      3.   One (1) of the members shall be nominated by the Town Fiscal Body
(i.e. Town Council).
   b.   The Schererville Economic Development Commissioners shall take office
upon appointment, with the terms to run from February 1st after the original
appointment for a period of:
      1.   Three (3) years, if selected by the Town Executive;
      2.   Two (2) years, if nominated by the Town Fiscal Body (i.e. Town
Council); and
      3.   One (1) year, if nominated by the Lake County Fiscal Body (i.e. Lake
County Council).
   c.   At the expiration of the respective terms of each of the original
economic development commissioners, their respective successors shall be
selected and nominated, before the expiration of the term, in the same manner
as the original commissioner, and each succeeding commissioner shall serve for
a term of four (4) years. A commissioner shall hold over after the expiration
of his term until his successor is appointed and has qualified.
(Ord. No. 1723, § 3, 1-17-08)
Sec. 2-226 Incorporation and Implementation of State Statutes.
   The applicable terms and provisions of I.C. §§ 36-7-12, et seq., as amended,
are hereby incorporated herein and are implemented by the enactment of this
division. All such duties, responsibilities, powers, authorities, and related
statutory provisions for a Town unit of government for a Town department of
economic development controlled by the Schererville Economic Development
Commission are hereby incorporated herein and made a part hereof as though
fully set forth, and are to be implemented accordingly.
(Ord. No. 1723, § 4, 1-17-08)
Sec. 2-227 through Sec. 2-254 Reserved for Future Use.
