Sec. 2-407 Building Fund.
   a.   There is established a special fund which shall be known as the
"Building Fund."
   b.   "Capital Improvements" are defined as structures constructed for the
benefit of the Town of Schererville which have a value in excess of two hundred
fifty thousand dollars ($250,000.00), exclusive of land.
   c.   Funds shall be paid into aforesaid "Building Fund" as determined
available by the Town Council of the Town of Schererville, Indiana.
   d.   The funds deposited shall be used for the following purposes:
      1.   Payment for preliminary engineering and plans related to the
construction of buildings and facilities on behalf of the Town of Schererville,
Indian, the projected cost of aforesaid buildings and facilities being in
excess of two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000.00).
      2.   For the construction costs associated with any and all capital
improvements as defined in this ordinance.
(Ord. No. 1391, § § 1-4, 9-10-97)
Sec. 2-408 77th Avenue Road Improvement Fund.
   a.   There is established the special fund which shall be known as the "77th
Avenue Road Improvement Fund."
   b.   Said fund shall be financed or funded through the collection of one-
half (1/2) of all fines paid into the Schererville Town Court regarding
violations of the overweight vehicle ordinance on 77th Avenue.
   c.   The "77th Avenue Road Improvement Fund" shall be utilized for the
specific purpose of maintenance and improvements to 77th Avenue as deemed
necessary by the Town.
(Ord. No. 1393, § § 1-3, 9-10-97)
   d.   Fifty percent (50%) of any and all fines collected by the Schererville
Town Court for violation of the weight restriction on 77th Avenue shall be paid
into the "77th Avenue Road Improvement Fund."
   e.   The remaining fifty percent (50%) of any and all fines collected for
violation of aforesaid ordinance shall be paid into the "Police Equipment
Fund."
   f.   The court shall collect and disburse court costs as previously
established by statute.
(Ord. No. 1394, §§ 1-3, 9-10-97)
Sec. 2-409 Police Training Fund.
   a.   There is established the special fund which shall be known as the
"Schererville Police Department Training Fund."
   b.   This fund shall receive the sum of twenty five dollars ($25.00) from
each and every deferred prosecution fee collected by the Schererville Town
Court regarding ordinance violations; and furthermore, any monies that were
previously collected for aforesaid pre-trial diversion program and paid into
the L.E.C.E.F. Fund shall be transferred to this find instanter.
   c.   The funds collected shall be utilized for the training of police
department personnel.
(Ord. No. 1395, § § 1-3, 9-10-97)
Sec. 2-410 Downtown Revitalization Fund.
   a.   There is established a special fund which shall be known as the
Schererville Downtown Revitalization Fund.
   b.   The funds collected by the Schererville Downtown Revitalization
Committee shall be deposited in aforesaid fund and shall be utilized for the
purpose of redevelopment of the Schererville downtown area.
(Ord. No. 1397, § § 1-2, 10-8-97)
Sec. 2-411 Asset Seizure Fund.
   a.   The money in question shall be placed into the "Asset Seizure" fund of
the Police Department budget.
   b.   The Schererville Police Department shall then be authorized to deposit
the seized funds into an interest-bearing account with an approved financial
institution.
   c.   The Chief of Police shall have the discretion not to deposit funds into
an interest-bearing account if there exists a valid reason for them to remain
in the evidentiary room, such as a chain of custody situation.
   d.   The funds shall remain in the interest-bearing account until an order
is received from a court with jurisdiction over the funds as to what party
holds an ownership interest in the monies.
(Ord. No. 1419, §§ 1-4, 5-13-98)
Sec. 2-412 Petty Cash Fund for Town Court.
   a.   A Petty Cash Fund is established within the Town Court of the Town of
Schererville, Lake County, Indiana. In establishing the Petty Cash Fund, the
Town Court shall establish and maintain all statutory and proper procedures for
the transfer, use and expenditures of monies from said Petty Cash Fund.
   b.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and required to transfer
the necessary funds to said Petty Cash Fund of the Town Court to effectuate the
purposes required for said Petty Cash Fund, pursuant to statutory requirements.
(Ord. No. 1442, §§ 1-2, 10-14-98)
   c.   The Schererville Town Court Petty Cash Fund shall be established in the
amount of two hundred dollars ($200.00).
   d.   The Schererville Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and required
to transfer the amount of two hundred dollars ($200.00) to said Petty Cash Fund
of the Town Court to effectuate the purposes required for said Petty Cash Fund,
pursuant to statutory requirements.
(Ord. No. 1442A, §§ 1-2, 4-14-99)
Sec. 2-413 Petty Cash Fund for Park Department.
   a.   A Petty Cash Fund is established within the Park Department of the Town
of Schererville, Lake County, Indiana. In establishing the Petty Cash Fund, the
Park Department shall establish and maintain all statutory and proper
procedures for the transfer, use and expenditures of monies from said Petty
Cash Fund.
   b.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and required to transfer
five hundred dollars ($500.00) to said Petty Cash Fund of the Park Department
to effectuate the purposes required for said Petty Cash Fund, pursuant to
statutory requirements.
(Ord. No. 1456, §§ 1-2, 4-14-99)
Sec. 2-414 Petty Cash Fund for Clerk-Treasurer's Office.
   a.   A Petty Cash Fund is established within the Clerk-Treasurer's Office of
the Town of Schererville, Lake County, Indiana. In establishing the Petty Cash
Fund, the Clerk-Treasurer's Office shall establish and maintain all statutory
and proper procedures for the transfer, use and expenditures of monies from
said Petty Cash Fund.
   b.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and required to transfer
three hundred dollars ($300.00) to said Petty Cash Fund of the Clerk-
Treasurer's Office to effectuate the purposes required for said Petty Cash
Fund, pursuant to statutory requirements.
(Ord. No. 1457, §§ 1-2, 4-14-99)
Sec. 2-415 Clerk's Record Perpetuation Fund.
   a.   There is established a fund, designated specifically as the Clerk's
Record Perpetuation Fund.
(Ord. No. 1483, § 1, 3-8-00)
   b.   The established Clerk's Record Perpetuation Fund will be utilized when
a defendant fails to notify the Schererville Town Court of the intention to
either pay or deny the charge against said defendant, or when a defendant fails
to pay a charge, fine or penalty levied against said defendant, resulting in
the citation issued by the Schererville Town Court being transmitted to the
Indiana Bureau of Motor Vehicles for suspension of driver's license privileges.
When the citation is paid by a defendant thereafter, it is necessary for the
Schererville Town Court to transmit a prescribed form to the Indiana Bureau of
Motor Vehicles by either first class mail or facsimile transmission for
reinstatement of the driver's license privileges of any suspended person. A fee
is hereby assessed in the amount of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for each
transmission to the Indiana Bureau of Motor Vehicles regarding suspensions or
reinstatements of driver's license privileges. The fee charged for such
purposes shall be collected by the Clerking Staff of the Schererville Town
Court, and said monies collected shall be deposited in the established Clerk's
Record Perpetuation Fund under the control and authority of the Clerk-Treasurer
of the Town of Schererville. All said fees shall be remitted to the Town Clerk-
Treasurer on a regular basis as the same are collected by the Schererville Town
Court.
(Ord. No. 1483, § 2, 3-8-00)
   c.   The funds deposited into the Clerk's Record Perpetuation Fund
established hereby may only be expended after appropriation for Court record
keeping improvements and equipment. All expenditures from the Clerk's Record
Perpetuation Fund shall be processed, appropriated, claimed and/or allowed in
the same manner as all other claims of the Town of Schererville, in conformance
with applicable law.
(Ord. No. 1483, § 3, 3-8-00)
Sec. 2-416 Supplemental Public Defender Fund.
   a.   There is established a Supplemental Public Defender Fund for the
Schererville Town Court. This Supplemental Public Defender Fund may be used to
supplement the provision for court-appointed legal services, and may not be
used to replace other funding of court-appointed legal services.
(Ord. No. 1497, § 1, 7-12-00)
   b.   The monies deposited in the established Supplemental Public Defender
Fund at the end of each year shall not revert to any other fund, but shall
continue to remain in the Supplemental Public Defender Fund for the purposes
contemplated by law, namely, Public Defender Services, fees, costs, and the
like.
(Ord. 1497, § 2, 7-12-00)
   c.   Monies deposited into the Supplemental Public Defender Fund are those
monies which are required to be paid by a defendant at any time during
prosecution for a misdemeanor criminal offense once the Town Court makes a
finding that such defendant has the ability to pay the costs of representation,
and in the manner prescribed by Indiana Code, § 33-9-11.5-6 and § 33-9-11.5-7,
as each are amended from time to time. The costs collected may include
reasonable attorney's fees in the event a public defender was appointed by the
Court. All fees collected hereby shall be deposited into the Supplemental
Public Defender Fund established herein.
(Ord. 1497, § 3, 7-12-00)
Sec. 2-417 Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund.
   a.   There is established a Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund for
the Schererville Town Court. This Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund
may be used to supplement probation services and to provide the salaries for
probation officers within the Probation Department of the Town of Schererville,
and may not be used to replace other funding of probation services.
(Ord. No. 1499, § 1, 7-12-00)
   b.   The monies deposited in the Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund
shall not revert to any other fund at the end of a fiscal year, but shall
continue to remain in the Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund for the
purposes contemplated by law, namely, supplemental probation services and
salaries for probation officers.
(Ord. No. 1499, § 2, 7-12-00)
   c.   Monies deposited into the Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund
are those monies which the Town Court shall order a person convicted of a
proper level of crime to pay to the Town Probation Department as a Probation
User's Fee and/or a Probation Monitoring Fee, as provided by applicable law, as
amended from time to time. The fees assessed and collected may include an
initial Probation User's Fee and subsequent monthly Probation User's Fees, and/
or a Probation Monitoring Fee, as provided by applicable law, as amended from
time to time. All Probation User's Fees and Probation Monitoring Fees collected
hereby under Orders of the Judge of the Schererville Town Court shall be
deposited into the Supplemental Adult Probation Services Fund established
herein.
(Ord. No. 1499, § 3, 7-12-00; Ord. No. 1524, § 1, 4-11-01)
Sec. 2-418 Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is established for the Town Court of the Town of Schererville, a
Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund pursuant to the provisions of
Indiana Code, §§ 36-1-3-1, et seq., as amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1505, § 1, 12-9-00)
   b.   The newly established Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund
for the Town Court shall be funded with the monitoring fees paid to the Town
Court by the Prosecuting Attorney for the 31st Judicial District of Indiana for
the services rendered and provided to the Town Court to the Prosecuting
Attorney for monitoring each participant in the deferral program.
(Ord. No. 1505, § 2, 12-9-00)
   c.   The Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund established hereby
shall be reviewed annually by the Town Council. The funds directed to be
deposited into the Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund established
hereby shall include fees paid by participants of the Deferral Program, as
determined by the Town Court, as well as interest accrued and earned on the
account in which said funds are deposited. The funds directed to be deposited
into the Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund established hereby
shall be utilized for the use of the Town Court for educational seminars for
Town Court personnel, for payment of expenses incurred in relationship to the
administration of the monitoring of participants in the Deferral Program of the
Prosecuting Attorney, or for any related purpose.
(Ord. No. 1505, § 3, 12-9-00; Ord. No. 1531, § 1, 6-13-01)
   d.   The Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund established hereby
shall continue as a non-reverting fund until or unless amended or repealed by
subsequent ordinance. The fund balance maintained in the Special Deferral
Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund established hereby shall be non-reverting at the
end of each calendar year. In the event that the Special Deferral Program Fee
Non-Reverting Fund is repealed, it is no longer utilized or needed for such
purposes, the funds within the Special Deferral Program Fee Non-Reverting Fund
shall, at that time, be deposited into the General Fund of the Town.
(Ord. No. 1505, § 4, 12-9-00)
Sec. 2-419 Safe Kids Chapter Fund.
   a.   There is established a special fund which shall be known as the
Schererville Safe Kids Chapter Fund.
   b.   All monies collected by way of grants or donations and deposited in the
Schererville Safe Kids Chapter Fund shall be utilized for the purposes of
benefitting or enhancing the Child Safety Seat Program of the Town of
Schererville and for the purpose of helping to reduce unintentional injuries
and deaths to children under the age of 14.
(Ord. No. 1532, 6-13-01)
Sec. 2-419.1 Police Department Special Grants Fund.
   a.   There is established a Schererville Police Department Special Grants
Non-Reverting Fund pursuant to the provisions of Indiana Code, §§ 36-1-3-1, et
seq., as amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1534, § 1, 8-8-01)
   b.   The newly established Schererville Police Department Special Grants
Fund shall be funded with special grants received by the Schererville Police
Department.
(Ord. No. 1534, § 2, 8-8-01)
   c.   The Schererville Police Department Special Grants Fund established
hereby shall be reviewed annually by the Town Council. The funds directed to be
deposited into the Schererville Police Department Special Grants Fund
established hereby shall be utilized solely for the purposes set out in each
special grant received by the Schererville Police Department.
(Ord. No. 1534, § 3, 8-8-01)
Sec. 2-419.2 Deposits Non-Reverting Escrow Fund.
   a.   There is established a Deposits Non-Reverting Escrow Fund for the Town
which shall be commonly known as the Deposits Escrow Fund. The established
Deposits Escrow Fund shall be used as a holding fund for all miscellaneous
short-term deposits made to the Town including, but not limited to, park
program deposits, refundable park reservation deposits, special use temporary
water meter deposits, and any and all other similar such deposits made to the
town as determined by the Town Clerk-Treasurer shall be deposited into said
fund.
   b.   All funds deposited into the Deposits Escrow Fund shall be retained and
held in said fund until such time as said temporary deposits are to be returned
in full or in part to the depositor, or to a specific Town department to which
payment is to be made for programs provided to the depositor, or as payment of
damages and/or clean up of town property following the use of town property by
said depositor. The release of any temporary deposits held and maintained in
the Deposits Escrow Fund shall be released and/or paid upon written
verification from the department head of the town department affected and
involved in the deposit made. The Town Clerk-Treasurer shall determine the
appropriate form of written documentation required for distribution of said
funds.
   c.   The Deposits Escrow Fund shall further be required to be held,
maintained and managed in conformance with the applicable requirements of the
Indiana State Board of Accounts, and all regulations and requirements of said
entity as the same may be amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1580 §§ 1-3, 4-9-03)
Sec. 2-419.3 U.S. Postage Stamp Fund.
   a.   Pursuant to the provision of the Indiana Code §§ 36-1-3, et seq. (“The
Indiana Home Rule Act”) there is established a special non-reverting U.S.
Postage Stamp Fund for the Town, which special non-reverting fund shall be
known as the U.S. Postage Stamp Fund.
   b.   The U.S. Postage Fund established hereby will be initially funded by
and from the General Fund of the Town, which funds shall be utilized to
purchase U.S. postage stamps from the United States Postal Service at the
prevailing first class postage rate. That the U.S. postage stamps purchased
through the U.S. Postage Stamp Fund established hereby shall be available for
sale and purchase by residents of the Town, who shall be permitted to
repurchase same at cost and with no income or profit to the Town. It is
recognized specifically that this is a courtesy and benefit to the residents of
the Town who utilize the Town administrative offices, including that of the
Clerk-Treasurer, for business purposes, and that said postage stamp
availability is a substantial convenience and benefit to said residents.
   c.   All purchase activities by the Town of postage stamps from the United
States Postal Service shall be consistent with the rules, regulations and
requirements of the United States Postal Service. That all monies collected
from the sale and purchase of postage of the town offices shall be deposited
into the U.S. Postage Stamp Fund established hereby for the purpose of
purchasing additional postage stamp books from the United States Postal Service
on an on-going basis.
   d.   The Town Clerk-Treasurer shall be responsible and administer the sale
of postage stamps to residents of the Town through the officers of the Town
Clerk-Treasurer, and shall be responsible for all receipts, accounting, and
procedures required by the Indiana State Board of Accounts, for the same, as
such procedures are amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1584 § 1-4, 5-14-03)
Sec. 2-419.4 Special Newspaper Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Special Newspaper Non-Reverting Fund,
which shall be a non-reverting fund under the rules and regulations and
requirements of applicable Indiana law, including the Indiana Code, as amended
from time to time as well as the administrative rules and requirements of the
Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   Any monies collected from the sale of advertisement in the Town's
quarterly newspaper shall be deposited into the Newspaper Non-Reverting Fund,
as well as any and all other monies that are specifically identified to be used
in connection with said quarterly newspaper.
   c.   The monies deposited into the Newspaper Non-Reverting Fund shall be
utilized and spent only to supplement the costs incurred in connection with
publication of the Town's quarterly newspaper, and all activities related
thereto, as approved and authorized by the Town Council.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish said special Newspaper Non-
Reverting Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable law, as
amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1622, §§ 1-4, 7-14-04)
Sec. 2-419.5 Special Town Ambulance Equipment Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established a Special Town Ambulance Equipment Non-
Reverting Fund for purposes of establishing a maintenance and capital
improvement funding source for Town ambulance equipment, pursuant to the
provisions of Indiana Code 36-1-3-1 et seq., as amended from time to time.
   b.   The established Special Town Ambulance Equipment Non-Reverting Fund
shall be funded from ambulance service rate fees paid to the Town for the
provision of ambulance services, as specified in the ambulance user fee/rate
ordinance, as amended from time to time.
   c.   The funds deposited into the Special Town Ambulance Equipment Non-
Reverting Fund established hereby shall be reviewed on an annual basis by the
Town Council. Funds collected and deposited into the Special Ambulance
Equipment Non-Reverting Fund established hereby shall be utilized solely for
maintenance and/or capital improvements for Town ambulance equipment. Said
funds are to be used as indicated, and as authorized and approved by the Town
Council.
   d.   The established Special Town Ambulance Equipment Non-Reverting Fund
established hereby shall continue as a Non-Reverting Fund until or unless
amended or repealed by subsequent Ordinance of the Town. The fund balance in
the Special Town Ambulance Equipment Non-Reverting Fund established hereby
shall be non-reverting at each calendar year end. In the event that the Special
Non-Reverting Fund is terminated by repeal or amendatory ordinance, the funds
contained therein at the time of termination of the Non-Reverting Fund by
repeal or ordinance shall be deposited into the General Fund of the Town.
(Ord. No. 1641, § 1, 4-13-05)
Sec. 2-419.6 Major Moves Construction Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town of Schererville Major Moves
Construction Fund, which shall be a special revenue fund under the rules,
regulations, and requirements of applicable Indiana law, including the Indiana
Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and

   b.   All monies and funds received by the Town from the Major Moves
Construction Fund distribution from the Auditor of Lake County, Indiana, shall
be deposited into the Town of Schererville Major Moves Construction Fund.
   c.   The monies deposited into the Town of Schererville Major Moves
Construction Fund shall be utilized and expended only for the purposes set
forth in Indiana Code § 8-14-16-5, as the same exists presently, or as amended
from time to time hereafter.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish said Town of Schererville Major
Moves Construction Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable law,
as amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1681, §§ 1-4, 9-27-06)
Sec. 2-419.7 Special Town Pennsy Greenway Bike Trail Project Non-Reverting
Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established for the Town a Special Town Pennsy Greenway
Bike Trail Non-Reverting Fund for purposes of establishing a purchase,
operation, maintenance and capital improvement funding source for the Pennsy
Greenway Bike Trail being developed in Town, pursuant to the provisions of
Indiana Code § 36-1-3-1 et seq., as amended from time to time.
   b.   The established Special Town Pennsy Greenway Bike Trail Project Non-
Reverting Fund shall be funded from the lease rental payments to the Town by
Lamar Sign Co., Inc., for lease rental obligations for use in the purchase,
operation, maintenance, and capital improvement of said Pennsy Greenway Bike
Trail Project, as well as for all other bike trails and pedestrian facilities
in the Town purchased, operated, maintained and utilized by the residents of
the Town of Schererville under the jurisdictional authority of the Town
Department of Parks and Recreation, all as determined by the Town Council.
   c.   The funds deposited into the Special Town Pennsy Greenway Bike Trail
Non-Reverting Fund established hereby shall be reviewed on an annual basis by
the Town Council. Funds collected and deposited into the Special Pennsy
Greenway Bike Trail Project Non-Reverting Fund established hereby shall be
utilized solely for purchase, operation, maintenance and/or capital
improvements for the Pennsy Greenway Bike Trail, or any other bike trail or
pedestrian facilities in the Town of Schererville under the jurisdictional
authority of the Town Department of Parks and Recreation. Said funds are to be
used as indicated, and as authorized and approved by the Town Council.
   d.   The established Special Town Pennsy Greenway Bike Trail Non-Reverting
Fund established hereby shall continue as a Non-Reverting Fund until or unless
amended or repealed by subsequent ordinance of the Town. The fund balance in
the Special Town Pennsy Greenway Bike Trail Non-Reverting Fund established
hereby shall be non-reverting at each calendar year end. In the event that the
Special Non- Reverting Fund is terminated by repealer or amendatory ordinance,
the funds contained therein at the time of termination of the Non-Reverting
Fund by repealer or amendatory ordinance shall be deposited into the General
Fund of the Town.
(Ord. No. 1683, §§ 1-4, 9-27-06; Ord. No. 1683A, §§ 2, 3, 5-11-11)
Sec. 2-419.8 Special Non-Reverting Stormwater Permit Fee Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town Special Non-Reverting Stormwater
Permit Fee Fund, which shall be a special revenue fund under the rules,
regulations and requirements of applicable Indiana Law, including the Indiana
Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and
requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   All stormwater permit fees collected under the Storm Drainage
Regulations Control Ordinance of the Town, as amended from time to time, shall
be deposited into the Special Non-Reverting Stormwater Permit Fee Fund. The
stormwater permit fees collected under the provisions of the Town Storm
Drainage Regulations Control Ordinance and deposited into the Special Non-
Reverting Stormwater Permit Fee Fund shall be utilized and expended for the
administrative review, inspection and documentation reporting purposes set
forth in the Storm Drainage Regulations Control Ordinance, as amended from time
to time, and no other.
   c.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish the Special Non-Reverting
Stormwater Permit Fee Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable
law, as amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1710, §§ 1-3, 7-11-07)
Sec. 2-419.9 High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) Program Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town HIDTA Program Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund, which shall be a special revenue fund under the rules,
regulations and requirements of applicable Indiana Law, including the Indiana
Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and
requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   All grant monies issued to the Town, as the fiduciary agent and
sponsoring agency for the Lake County, Indiana High Intensity Drug Trafficking
Area (HIDTA) Program, shall be deposited into the HIDTA Program Special Revenue
Non-Reverting Fund.
   c.   The monies from the ONDCP meant for the Lake County, Indiana HIDTA
Program shall be deposited into the HIDTA Program Special Revenue Non-Reverting
Fund, and said funds shall be utilized and expended only as permitted and
authorized by the rules and regulations of the ONDCP for the Lake County,
Indiana HIDTA Program, consistent with the applicable rules, regulations and
requirements of applicable Indiana Law, including the Indiana Code, as amended
from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and requirements of the
Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish the HIDTA Program Special Revenue
Non-Reverting Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable law, as
amended from time to time.
   e.   The HIDTA Program Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall be
established and shall exist as long as the Town continues to act as the
fiduciary agent and sponsoring agency for the Lake County, Indiana, High
Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) Program. In the event that the Lake
County, Indiana HIDTA Program is terminated, or the Town does not continue to
act as the fiduciary agent and sponsoring agency for the Lake County, Indiana
HIDTA Program, then upon payment of all valid and proper expenses required to
be paid and made from the special non-reverting fund, the special non-reverting
fund shall be closed, and all funds remaining, if any, shall be transferred to
the appropriate agency or authority under the then-applicable rules,
regulations or policies of the Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP).
(Ord. No. 1717, §§ 1-5, 10-10-07)
Sec. 2-419.10 Improvement Inspection Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town Improvement Inspection Fee Special
Non-Reverting Fund, which shall be a special non-reverting revenue fund under
the rules, regulations, and requirements of applicable Indiana Law, including
the Indiana Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the Administrative
Rules and Requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   All improvement inspection fees paid pursuant to the provisions of the
Town Subdivision Control Ordinance, as amended from time to time, in an amount
equal to two percent (2%) of the cost of such improvements, as estimated by the
Town Engineer, used to defray a portion of the costs incurred by the Town in
the administration, planning, legal, engineering, inspection, review, and all
other direct or indirect expenses incurred by the Town in connection with
review and inspection of the installation of all improvements required by the
Town Subdivision Control Ordinance, as amended from time to time, shall be
deposited into the Improvement Inspection Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund, and
said funds shall be utilized and expended only as permitted and authorized by
the provisions of the Town Subdivision Control Ordinance, as amended from time
to time, including, Section
10-274. Such funds deposited pursuant to the provisions set forth herein into
the Improvement Inspection Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund shall be utilized and
expended only as permitted by the specific provisions of Town Subdivision
Control Ordinance, as amended from time to time, to pay the costs incurred by
the Town in the administration, planning, legal, engineering, inspection,
review, and all other direction or indirection expenses incurred by the Town in
connection with review and inspection of the installation of all improvements
required by the Town Subdivision Control Ordinance. Further, such funds shall
be utilized and expended only as permitted and authorized consistent with the
applicable rules, regulations, and requirements of applicable Indiana Law,
including the Indiana Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the
Administrative Rules and Requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   c.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish the Improvement Inspection Fee
Special Non-Reverting Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable
law, as amended from time to time, as set forth herein above, and in the Town
Subdivision Control Ordinance regarding such fund, as amended from time to
time.
(Ord. No. 1718, §§ 1-3, 11-20-07)
Sec. 2-419.11 High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) Administrative
Revenue Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town HIDTA Administrative Revenue Fee
Special Non-Reverting Fund, which shall be a special non-reverting fund under
the rules, regulations and requirements of applicable Indiana Law, including
the Indiana Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the administrative
rules and requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   The administration fee paid and distributed to the Town, as the
fiduciary agent and sponsoring agency for the Lake County, Indiana High
Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) Program, as the same is paid and
received by the Town, shall be deposited into the HIDTA Administrative Revenue
Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund.
   c.   The administrative fee paid by the ONDCP to the Town pursuant to the
Town's Fiduciary Agreement with the Lake County, Indiana HIDTA Executive Board
shall be deposited into the HIDTA Administrative Revenue Fee Special Non-
Reverting Fund, and said administrative fee shall be utilized and expended as
determined appropriate and authorized by the Town Council, consistent with the
applicable rules, regulations and requirements of applicable Indiana Law,
including the Indiana Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the
administrative rules and requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish the HIDTA Administrative Revenue
Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund in conformance and compliance with all
applicable law, as amended from time to time, as set forth.
   e.   The HIDTA Administrative Revenue Fee Special Non-Reverting Fund shall
be established and shall exist as long as the Town continues to act as the
fiduciary agent and sponsoring agency for the Lake County, Indiana, High
Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) Program pursuant to its approved
Fiduciary Agreement. In the event that the Lake County, Indiana HIDTA Program
is terminated, or the Town does not continue to act as the fiduciary agent and
sponsoring agency for the Lake County, Indiana HIDTA Program, then upon payment
of all valid and proper expenses required and authorized by the Town Council to
be paid and made from the HIDTA Administrative Revenue Fee Special Non-
Reverting Fund, the special non-reverting fund shall be closed, and all funds
remaining, if any, shall be transferred to the fund or funds authorized and
approved by the Town Council for transfer of same.
(Ord. No. 1721, §§ 1-5, 12-12-07)
Sec. 2-419.12 Farmers’ Market Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town Farmers’ Market Special Revenue
Non-Reverting Fund, which shall be a special revenue fund under the rules,
regulations and requirements of applicable Indiana Law, including the Indiana
Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and
requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   Any monies collected as donations, from event participation and/or
registrations fees, as well as appropriations from other Town funds, shall be
deposited into the Farmers’ Market Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund, as well
as any and all of the monies that are specifically identified to be used in
connection with said designated community event and activities. The Farmers’
Market Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall be initially funded by the Town
Cable TV Promotion Fund in the amount of two thousand dollars ($2,000.00) for
the purpose of initial setup costs, advertising, and related.
   c.   The monies deposited into the Farmers’ Market Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund shall be utilized and expended only to supplement and pay the
costs incurred in connection with the planning, coordination and carrying out
of the seasonal Farmers’ Market Community Event, and all activities related
thereto, as approved and authorized by the Town Council.
   d.   The following schedule of fees per space shall be charged for
participation in the Schererville Farmers’ Market, to-wit:
      1.   For participation in a minimum of three (3) individual Thursday
events, a fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per event shall be charged to
each vendor and collected;
      2.   For participation in five (5) weeks of events, a fee of one hundred
twenty dollars ($120.00) per vendor shall be charged to and collected from each
vendor as a participation rate in lieu of the minimum session rate referenced
herein. This shall include either five (5) Thursdays or four (4) Thursdays and
one (1) Sunday;
      3.   For participation in nine (9) weeks of events, a fee of two hundred
dollars ($200.00) per vendor shall be charged to and collected from each vendor
as a participation rate in lieu of the minimum session rate referenced herein.
This shall include either nine (9) Thursdays or seven (7) Thursdays and two (2)
Sundays.
      4.   For participation in a full season schedule of events, a fee of two
hundred thirty eight dollars ($238.00) per vendor shall be charged to and
collected from each vendor as a seasonal participation rate in lieu of the
individual session rate referenced herein.
      5.   For participation in only one (1) Sunday event, a fee of fifty
dollars ($50.00) per vendor shall be charged to and collected from each vendor
as participation rate in lieu of the minimum session rate referenced herein.
      6.   For participation in four (4) Sunday events only, a fee of one
hundred seventy five dollars ($175.00) per vendor shall be charged to and
collected from each vendor as a participation rate in lieu of the minimum
session rate referenced herein.
      7.   A produce vendor shall be able to participate in the event at no
cost. If the produce vendor attends every event (18 total events), an incentive
check for $180.00 shall be issued to that vendor once confirmation of
attendance has been received by the Clerk-Treasurer.
         (a)   “Produce Vendor” shall exclusively sell farm products such as
fresh fruits, vegetables, mushrooms, herbs, nuts, eggs, honey, livestock food
products (including meat, milk, cheese and dairy products), and seafood.
      8.   Any and all fees include applicable Indiana State sales tax.
   e.   For participation in the Schererville Farmers’ Market event or events,
each participating vendor shall provide satisfactory proof of insurance,
Federal Tax Identification or Social Security Number, and State Tax
Identification Number with the payment of the event or seasonal participation
fee. Upon collection of any fees herein, the same shall be deposited into the
Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund created hereby, and processed in conformance
with applicable law.
   f.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and directed to take all
appropriate and required steps to establish the Farmers’ Market Special Revenue
Non-Reverting Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable law, as
amended from time to time.
   g.   The Farmers’ Market Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall be
established and shall exist as long as the community event or events with which
it is associated occurs on at least an annual basis; however, in the event that
said designated community event, or substantially similar community event, does
not reoccur within one calendar year, the balance of any monies remaining in
the Farmers’ Market Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund for the Schererville
Farmers’ Market Community Event activity shall be transferred and receipted to
the Town General Fund.
(Ord. No. 1692, §§ 1-6, 3-14-07; Ord. No. 1692A, § 1, 4-8-09; Ord. No. 1692B, §
1, 3-10-10; Ord. No. 1692C, 3- 28-12; Ord No. 1692D, § 1, 3-9-16)
Sec. 2-419.13 Park and Recreation Grants Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established for the Town of Schererville a Park &
Recreation Grants Non-Reverting Fund pursuant to the provisions of I.C. §§ 36-
1-3-1, et seq., as amended from time to time.
   b.   The newly established Fund shall be funded with special grants received
by the Schererville Park & Recreation Department.
   c.   The Fund established hereby shall be reviewed annually by the Town
Council. The funds directed to be deposited into the Fund shall be utilized
solely for the purposes set out in each special grant received by the Park &
Recreation Department.
(Ord. No. 1729, §§ 1-3, 3-12-08)

Sec. 2-419.15   Town Promotion Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established a fund entitled “Town Promotion Fund”
pursuant to the applicable provisions of I.C. 36-7-2-7 to be used to promote
economic development, Town promotions, and tourism, as well as all other
permitted uses under said Indiana Code section, as same may be amended from
time to time.
   b.   The Town Promotion Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund is hereby
established for the purpose of funding economic development, Town promotions,
and tourism, including the payment of expenses of, or reimbursement of Town
Officials, as the case may be, for expenses incurred in promoting the best
interests of the Town, including, but not limited to, such expenditures as are
identified and permitted set forth in division c. of this section. Funds for
the purposes and uses permitted and as set forth hereafter in division c. of
this section shall be budgeted, appropriated and/or transferred from the Cable
TV Fund, and provided for in the Town Code, as amended, and in conformance with
the requirements of applicable law, as amended from time to time.
   c.   Permitted expenditures from the Town Promotion Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund established hereby may include, are but are not necessarily
limited to, any of the following type expenses, namely:
      1.   The rental of meeting places, meals, decorations, memorabilia,
awards, expenses incurred in interviewing job applicants, expenses incurred in
promoting industrial, commercial and residential development, expenses incurred
in developing relations with other units of government, in the promotion of
tourism and goodwill of the Town’s employees, and any other expenses of a
specific or governmental nature deemed by the Town Council to be in the best
interests of the Town.
      2.   Illustrative of the expenditures approved by this section may
include, but are not necessarily limited to the following: commemorative
plaques, certificates, or objects such as commemorative keys; employee
appreciation dinners; and expenses incurred due to participation or membership
in local, regional, state and national association of a social, educational or
governmental nature which expense(s) shall have as its purpose the betterment
of the Town or the Town’s operations.
   d.   The establishment of the Town Promotion Special Revenue Non-Reverting
Fund by the provisions of the within enabling establishment ordinance shall
have no limiting effect or otherwise upon any other fund of the Town of
Schererville, including printing and advertising, meeting room rental,
subscriptions and dues, traveling expenses, and other similar fund, line item
or account of the Town.
   e.   The Town Promotion Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund established
hereby shall be a special revenue non-reverting fund under the rules,
regulations and requirements of applicable Indiana law, including the Indiana
Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and
requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts. The Town Clerk-Treasurer
is hereby directed to follow and comply with all rules, regulations and
requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts as well as the applicable
provisions of the Indiana Code for establishment of the Town Promotion Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund, processing of expenditures therefrom, budgeting and
appropriation of funds therefrom, and all other legal requirements, as the same
may be amended from time to time.
(Ord. No. 1788, §§ 1-5, 6-8-11; Ord. No. 1974, §§ 1-5, 9-14-11)

Sec. 2-419.19 County Economic Development Income Tax (CEDIT) Special Revenue
Non- Reverting Fund.
   a.   The Town Council of the Town of Schererville, Lake County, Indiana,
hereby establishes the Town County Economic Development Income Tax (CEDIT)
Special Revenue Non- Reverting Fund (hereinafter the “Fund”), for the deposit,
distribution and utilization of the County Economic Development Income Tax
imposed, collected and distributed to the Town of Schererville by the Auditor
of Lake County, Indiana, pursuant to the provisions of Indiana Code § 6-3.5-7-
1 et seq., as amended, which fund shall be a Special Revenue Non-Reverting
Fund.
   b.   The Town Clerk-Treasurer, upon receipt of distribution of said County
Public Economic Development Income Tax (CEDIT) Fund distributed to the Town of
Schererville pursuant to the applicable provisions of Indiana Code § 6-3.5-7-
1 et seq., shall deposit said funds into the Town County Economic Development
(CEDIT) Income Tax Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund established hereby for
use for economic development in the Town pursuant to the provisions of Indiana
Code § 6-3.5-7-1 et seq., as amended. Further, the funds deposited into said
Town County Economic Development Income Tax (CEDIT) Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund shall be appropriated and utilized for the economic development
purposes permitted, as set forth in Indiana Code § 6-3.5-7-13.1(b), as amended
from time to time.
   c.   Deposits and funds in the Town County Economic Development Income Tax
(CEDIT) Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall not revert to the General Fund
at the end of each calendar year, but shall remain in the Town County Economic
Development Income Tax (CEDIT) Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund, as permitted
by applicable law.
   d.   The Town Clerk-Treasurer is directed and authorized to take all
necessary and appropriate actions to establish and account for the funds
collected from the County Economic Development Income Tax (CEDIT) distributed
to the Town by the Lake County Auditor for the purposes and uses of economic
development in the Town pursuant to the provisions of Indiana Code § 6-3.5-7-
13.1(b), all in conformance with applicable law. (Ord. No. 1847, §§ 1-4, 1-30-
14)
Sec. 2-419.20 Adjusted Gross Income Tax Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   The Town Council of the Town of Schererville, Lake County, Indiana,
hereby establishes the Town Adjusted Gross Income Tax Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund (hereinafter the “Fund”), for the deposit, distribution and
utilization of the Public Safety County Adjusted Gross Income Tax imposed,
collected and distributed to the Town of Schererville pursuant to the
provisions of Indiana Code § 6-3.5-1.1-25, which fund shall be a Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   b.   The Town Clerk-Treasurer, upon receipt of distribution of said Lake
County Public Safety County Adjusted Gross Income Tax Funds distributed to the
Town of Schererville pursuant to the applicable provisions of Indiana Code § 6-
3.5-1.1-25, shall deposit said funds into the Town Adjusted Gross Income Tax
Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund established hereby for the purpose of
continuing to carry out or provide at least one public safety purpose pursuant
to the provisions of Indiana Code § 6-3.5-1.1-25(a). Further, the funds
deposited into said Town Adjusted Gross Income Tax Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund shall be appropriated and utilized for the public safety
purposes permitted, as set forth in Indiana Code § 6-3.5-1.1-25(a), as amended
from time to time.
   c.   Deposits and funds in the Town Adjusted Gross Income Tax Fund Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall not revert to the General Fund at the end of
each calendar year, but shall remain in the Town Adjusted Gross Income Tax
Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund, as permitted by applicable law.
   d.   The Town Clerk-Treasurer is directed and authorized to take all
necessary and appropriate actions to establish and account for the funds
collected from the Public Safety County Adjusted Gross Income Tax distributed
to the Town by the Lake County Auditor for the purposes and uses of carrying
out or providing at least one public safety purpose pursuant to the provisions
of Indiana Code § 6-3.5-1.1-25(a), all in conformance with applicable law.
(Ord. No. 1848, §§ 1-4, 1-30- 14)
Sec. 2-419.21 Culvert Repair Project Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the Town of Schererville Briar Ridge
Culvert Repair Project Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund, which shall be a
special revenue non-reverting fund under the rules, regulations and
requirements of applicable Indiana law, including the Indiana Code, as amended
from time to time, as well as the administrative rules and requirements of the
Indiana State Board of Accounts, as amended from time to time.
   b.   Any monies collected from each participating party for payment of
claims filed by the contractor and related vendors, under the agreement terms
of the Joint Interlocal Cooperation Agreement for the Briar Ridge Storm Sewer
System Repair/Improvement Project, shall be deposited into the Town of
Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair Project Special Revenue Non-Reverting
Fund. The Town of Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair Project Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall be initially funded by the Little Calumet
River basin Development commission contribution of up to the sum of $697,000,
and each of Schererville, Dyer, and Munster contributing one-third of the
remaining total costs to fully fund said project costs and payment
responsibilities.
   c.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town of Schererville, upon notice and
request from the Joint Board established by the aforementioned Joint Interlocal
Cooperation Agreement, shall be responsible to request payment, first from the
Little Calumet River Basin Development Commission, and thereafter from each of
the participating towns in equal shares. The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town of
Schererville shall place the receipts from each of the participating units,
upon such receipt, into the Town of Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair
Project Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund, which funds shall then be used
exclusively for payment of costs of the project following processing consistent
with applicable law.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town of Schererville shall account to the
Little Calumet River Basin development commission and the joint Board for
claims submitted, payments made, and the balance remaining in the Town of
Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair Project Special Revenue Non-Reverting
Fund, on a monthly basis.
   e.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town of Schererville shall obtain a partial
or full waiver of lien, and other documents required by the Public Works
Construction Contract, in exchange for each payment to a contractor or vendor
made from the Town of Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair Project Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   f.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town of Schererville is authorized and
directed to take all appropriate and required steps to establish the Town of
Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair Project Special Revenue Non-Reverting
Fund in conformance and compliance with all applicable law, as amended from
time to time.
   g.   The Town of Schererville Briar Ridge Culvert Repair Project Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund shall be established and shall exist until
termination or completion of the project.
(Ord. No. 1868, §§ 1-7, 5-13-15)
Sec. 2-419.22 Local Option Income Tax (LOIT) Y2016 Special Distribution Fund.
   a.   The Town Council hereby establishes a Local Option Income Tax (LOIT)
Y2016 Special Distribution Fund, as a special revenue non-reverting fund
pursuant to the applicable rules and regulations of the State of Indiana Board
of Accounts, if necessary and applicable, for deposit of a one-time Y2016 LOIT
Special Distribution amount received, or to be received, by the Town of
Schererville, consistent with recently promulgated SEA 67 in the last session
just concluded of the Indiana General Assembly. The Town Clerk-Treasurer is
hereby authorized and directed to establish the account required to be
established as set forth herein, consistent with the requirements for such
established by the Indiana State Board of Accounts, including the establishment
of a Y2016 LOIT Special Distribution Fund for deposit of the aforesaid LOIT
Y2016 Special Distribution.
   b.   The one-time LOIT Y2016 Special Distribution received by the Town shall
be deposited into said established Fund, with at least seventy-five percent
(75%) of said receipted Special Distribution funds to be deposited in the newly
established LOIT Y2016 Special Distribution Fund, with the balance of said one-
time LOIT Y2016 Special Distribution, if any, to be available for use by the
Town for any purpose deemed appropriate. The seventy-five percent (75%) or
greater portion of said one-time LOIT Y2016 Special Distribution received shall
be used exclusively for infrastructure as specified by the provisions of I.C. §
6-3.6-9-17(h)(l)(a), as amended from time to time, and the balance, if any, may
be used for any purpose deemed appropriate by the Town. (Ord. No. 1884, §§ 1,
2, 5-11-16)
Sec. 2-419.23 Community Events Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund.
   a.   There is hereby established the “Town of Schererville Community Events
Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund”, which shall be a special revenue fund
under the rules, regulations, and requirements of applicable Indiana law,
including the Indiana Code, as amended from time to time, as well as the
administrative rules and requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts.
   b.   Any monies or funds collected as donations from event participation
and/or registration fees, as well as appropriations from designated Town Funds,
shall be deposited into the “Town of Schererville Community Events Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund”, as well as any and all of the monies that are
specifically identified to be used in connection with said designated community
event and activities. The “Town of Schererville Community Events Special
Revenue Non-Reverting Fund” shall be funded initially by the Town of
Schererville CEDIT/NR Fund in the amount of $50,000.00 for the purpose of
initial costs, advertising, and related expenses for a qualified community
event which shall utilize said funds.
   c.   The monies and funds deposited into the “Town of Schererville Community
Events Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund” shall be utilized and expended only
to supplement and pay costs incurred in connection with planning, coordination
and conduct/carrying out of the designated Town of Schererville community event
for which the funds herein may be utilized, and all activities related thereto,
and only as approved and authorized by the Town Council. The Town Council shall
have the exclusive authority for the approved use of the funds in the “Town of
Schererville Community Events Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund”, as well as
for the designation of a community event qualifying for use of same.
   d.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is hereby authorized and directed to
take all appropriate and required legal actions to establish said “Town of
Schererville Community Events Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund”, in
conformance and compliance with all applicable law, as amended from time to
time.
   e.   The “Town of Schererville Community Events Special Revenue Non-
Reverting Fund” shall be established and shall exist as long as community
events exist for which funds in said “Town of Schererville Community Events
Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund” are utilized. It is contemplated that
specific and designated community events will be identified and approved
annually by the Town Council whereby funds in the “Town of Schererville
Community Events Special Revenue Non-Reverting Fund” will be available to be
utilized, and will, with approval of the Town Council, be utilized.
(Ord. No. 1886, §§ 1-5, 7-13-16)
Sec. 2-419.24 Rainy Day Fund.
   a.   Establishment of Rainy Day Fund. There is hereby established a “Rainy
Day Fund” for the Town of Schererville pursuant to the applicable provisions of
I.C. 36-1-8-5.1 et seq., as amended hereafter from time to time. The
established Town Rainy Day Fund may be used to receive transfers of unused and
unencumbered funds raised by a general or special tax levy on taxable property
within the Town whenever the purpose of such tax levy has been fulfilled and an
unused and unencumbered balance remains, as well as for all other funds/
transfers and uses as permitted by the applicable provisions of I.C. 36-1-8-5.1
et seq., and any and all other applicable statutory authority, as amended
hereafter from time to time. The Clerk-Treasurer shall establish the Town Rainy
Day Fund consistent with the enabling authority of I.C. 36-1-8-5.1, and the
rules, regulations, and requirements of the Indiana State Board of Accounts,
each as amended hereafter from time to time.
   b.   The Rainy Day Fund established hereby is a Non-Reverting Fund, as
recognized by applicable law and the rules, regulations, and requirements of
the Indiana State Board of Accounts, as each are amended hereafter from time to
time. The Rainy Day Fund Account funds shall be used only as permitted by the
provisions of I.C. 36-1-8-5.1, and as approved and agreed upon by the Town
Council.
(Ord. No. 1889, §§ 1, 2, 8-10-16)
Sec. 2-419.25 Law Enforcement Aid or Confidential Petty Cash Fund.
   A Police Department Law Enforcement Aid Fund (also known as Confidential
Petty Cash Fund) is established to be governed by procedures set forth in I.C.
§ 36-1-8-3, and the Fund shall maintain a balance of one thousand dollars
($1,000.00). (Ord. No. 1966, § 2, 5-12-21)
Sec. 2-419.26 Parks and Recreation Department Petty Cash Fund for Park
Concessions.
   a.   A Petty Cash Fund is hereby established for the Town Parks and
Recreation Department, and specifically for Park Concessions. The established
Town Parks and Recreation Petty Cash Fund shall follow and comply with all
statutory and proper procedures for the transfer and use and expenditures of
monies from Parks and Recreation, and specifically the procedures and
requirements of I.C. § 36-1-8-3, as amended. It is further hereby specified
that said Parks and Recreation Department Concession Petty Cash Fund shall
maintain a reportable balance of five hundred dollars ($500.00) in a monthly
accounting and reporting balance by designated Parks and Recreation Department
administrative staff, governed by procedures set forth in I.C. § 36-1-8-3, and
that the fund shall maintain a balance of five hundred dollars ($500.00).
   b.   The Clerk-Treasurer of the Town is authorized and required to transfer
the necessary funds to the Parks and Recreation Petty Cash Fund to the Park
Concessions of the Town to effectuate the purposes required for the Parks and
Recreation Petty Cash Fund, pursuant to all statutory requirements as described
herein, and all as amended from time to time. (Ord. No. 1968, §§ 1, 2, 5-12-21)
Sec. 2-419.27 ARP Local Fiscal Recovery Grant Fund.
   a.   The Town Council hereby acknowledges receipt of notification that the
Town will be allocated Grant Funds from the ARP; that as a consequence of same,
the Town Council hereby establishes the Town of Schererville ARP Local Fiscal
Recovery Grant Fund in conformance with the provisions of applicable law.
   b.   The Town Council hereby directs that all funds allocated to the Town of
Schererville from the ARP, upon receipt, shall be deposited into the newly
established Town of Schererville ARP Local Fiscal Recovery Grant Fund for
receipt of same, and use thereafter, consistent with the express and verified
purposes of the ARP. The Town Clerk-Treasurer is hereby directed and authorized
to so establish the ARP Local Fiscal Recovery Grant Fund in conformance with
applicable state and federal law. The Clerk-Treasurer shall further deposit any
grant funds received from the ARP into the newly established Town ARP Local
Fiscal Grant Fund for eligible and permitted uses consistent with the ARP
requirement.
   c.   The Town Clerk-Treasurer, upon receipt of ARP grant funds, shall
process additional appropriation proceedings as appropriate and required. Funds
deposited into the ARP Local Fiscal Recovery Grant Fund shall be used for any
lawful purpose, but only upon the Town Clerk-Treasurer and Town Council
concurring in the eligibility of proposed use of such funds as presented for
compliance with the Town of Schererville ARP Disbursement Plan. The Town
Council and Town Clerk-Treasurer acknowledge and concur that the types of uses
of the ARP Local Fiscal Recovery Grant Funds shall be as permitted and
authorized by the ARP Section 603(c), and other forthcoming substantive and
specific fund usage guidance, as amended from time to time. The Town Council
contemplates use for necessary investments in water, sewer and related
infrastructure and as otherwise permitted under Section 603(c) of the ARP. The
Town Council will further develop and establish a Town of Schererville, Lake
County, Indiana, ARP Disbursement Plan for usage purposes and monitor same for
amendment and update from time to time thereafter as appropriate. The Town
Clerk-Treasurer is further directed to maintain the requisite and legally
required detail of fund usage and expenditures in conformance with applicable
law, and to segregate said fund for purposes of audit hereafter by the State
Board of Accounts, or any other legal audit agency or entity.
(Ord. No. 1969, § 1-3, 5-12-21)
Article 11. Miscellaneous Administrative Regulations.
Sec. 2-420 South Shore Clean Cities Program Adopted.
   a.   The Town of Schererville adopts the South Shore Clean Cities program,
whose principal mission is to facilitate the creation of a sustained
alternative transportation fueled industry in northwest Indiana through the
introduction of alternatively fueled vehicles in the region's fleet and a
refueling and service infrastructure to support their use.
   b.   In adopting the South Shore Clean Cities program:
      1.   The Town of Schererville will appoint an official of this local
government entity with responsibilities for vehicle procurement to represent it
on the South Shore Clean Cities public/private partnership who along with other
members will carry out the partnership's mission and goals; and
      2.   In furtherance of South Shore Clean Cities mission and goals, the
Town of Schererville will:
         a.   give consideration to purchasing alternatively fueled vehicles
for its fleet that meet performance specifications, U.S. Environmental
Protection Agency emissions requirements, and are competitively priced; and
         b.   give consideration to joining other local governments in
alternatively fueled vehicle purchase program, thereby benefitting from the
savings realized from such high volume purchases.
      3.   The Town of Schererville will urge private sector fleet owners, who
do business with this local government entity and who are based and/or conduct
business within the Town of Schererville area of jurisdiction, to become a
member in the South Shore Clean Cities public/private partnership.
(Res. No. 96-9, 4-10-96)
Sec. 2-421 Standards for Capitalization of Assets.
   a.   Any individual item which costs five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) or
more shall be considered a capital asset.
   b.   Any related items which cost more than ten thousand dollars
($10,000.00) in the aggregate shall be considered capital assets.
(Ord. No. 1441, §§ 1-2, 10-14-98; Ord. No. 1527, § 1, 5-9-01)
Sec. 2-422 Fixed Asset/Capital Asset Policy.
   The Fixed Asset/Capital Asset Policy of the Town of Schererville is adopted
and established, and incorporated herein by reference. (Ord. No. 1944, § 1, 12-
11-19)
Sec. 2-423 Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Regulations.
   a.   The Town hereby acknowledges, recognizes and implements the provisions
of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (hereinafter
referred to as the "HIPAA Regulations") as the same apply to the Town, its
Departments and those persons and/or entities who conduct business with the
Town pertaining to these matters, under the designation of a "hybrid covered
entity."
   b.   The HIPAA Regulations shall be followed by the Town's Departments and
personnel, and those persons and/or entities who conduct business with the Town
(hereinafter referred to as "business associates"), pertaining to these
matters, to insure the protection of individuals' Protected Health Information.
   c.   The following definitions shall apply pursuant to the Town's HIPAA
Policy:
      1.   "Business Associate" shall mean a person and/or entity who, on
behalf of the Town or any of its Departments, performs, or assists in the
performance of:
         (a)   a function or activity involving the use or disclosure of
individually identifiable health information, including, but not limited to,
claims processing or administration, data analysis, processing or
administration, utilization review, quality assurance, billing, benefit
management, practice management, and repricing; or
         (b)   provides legal, actuarial, accounting, consulting, data
aggregation, management, administrative, accreditation or financial services to
or for such covered entity, or to or for an organized health care arrangement
in which the covered entity participates, where the provision of the service
involves the disclosure of individually identifiable health information from
such covered entity or arrangement, or from another business associate of such
covered entity or arrangement, to the person; or
         (c)   any other function or activity regulated by HIPAA Regulations or
this Ordinance.
         (d)   This definition does not apply to persons who are members of the
workforce of the Town or its Departments.
      2.   "Covered Entity" shall mean a health care provider who transmits any
health information in electronic form in connection with a transaction covered
by the HIPAA Regulations or this Ordinance.
      3.   "Health Care" shall include, but is not limited to:
         (a)   preventive, diagnostic, therapeutic, rehabilitative,
maintenance, or palliative care and counseling, service, assessment, or
procedure with respect to the physical or mental condition, or functional
status, of an individual or that affects the structure or function of the body;
or
         (b)   sale or dispensing of a drug, device, equipment, or other item
in accordance with a prescription.
      4.   "Health Care Provider" shall mean a provider of medical or health
services, and any other person or entity who furnishes, bills, or is paid for
health care in the normal course of business.
      5.   "Health Information" shall mean any information, whether oral or
recorded in any form or medium, that
         (a)   is created or received by a health care provider; and
         (b)   that relates to the past, present, or future physical or mental
health or condition of an individual, the provision of health care to an
individual, or the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health
care to an individual.
      6.   "Individually Identifiable Health Information" shall mean
information that is a subset of health information, including demographic
information collected from an individual and:
         (a)   that is created or received by a Town Department or Town
Business Associate; and
         (b)   relates to the past, present or future physical or mental health
or condition of an individual, the provision of health care to an individual,
or the past, present or future payment for the provision of health care to an
individual; and
            (1)   that identifies the individual; or
            (2)   with respect to which there is a reasonable basis to believe
the information could be used to identify the individual.
      7.   "Permitted Disclosure" shall mean a patient-authorized or legally
permitted disclosure of individually identifiable health information by a
covered entity.
      8.   "Protected Health Information" shall mean individually identifiable
health information that is transmitted and/or maintained in any form or medium
by the Town's Departments and/or its business associates.
      9.   "Required Disclosure" shall mean a disclosure of individually
identifiable health information that is required by applicable law, namely, the
HIPAA Regulations.
      10.   "Transaction" shall mean the transmission of information between
two (2) parties to carry out financial or administrative activities related to
health care. It shall include, but not be limited to, the following types of
information transmissions:
         (a)   health care claims or equivalent encounter information;
         (b)   health care payment and remittance advice;
         (c)   coordination of benefits;
         (d)   health care claim status;
         (e)   enrollment and disenrollment in a health plan;
         (f)   eligibility for a health plan;
         (g)   health plan premium payments;
         (h)   referral certification and authorization;
         (i)   first report of injury;
         (j)   health claims attachment; and
         (k)   other transactions that the Secretary of Health and Human
Services, or his/her duly authorized designee, may prescribe by regulation.
      11.   "Unpermitted Disclosure" shall mean an unauthorized or legally
prohibited disclosure of individually identifiable health information by a
covered entity.
      12.   "Workforce" shall mean employees, volunteers, trainees, and other
persons whose conduct, in the performance of work for a covered entity, is
under the direct control of such entity, whether or not such persons are paid
by the covered entity.
   d.   1.   The following shall constitute "Permitted Disclosures" pursuant to
the HIPAA Regulations and the provisions of this Ordinance:
         (a)   to the individual patient;
         (b)   for treatment, payment, or health care operations;
         (c)   incident to a use or disclosure permitted or required by HIPAA
Regulations with respect to an otherwise permitted or required use or
disclosure;
         (d)   when authorization has been obtained from the individual
patient.
      2.   When making a permitted disclosure, or when requesting the permitted
disclosure of individually identifiable health information from another covered
entity, reasonable efforts shall be made to limit the disclosure of protected
health information to the minimum necessary to satisfy the use, disclosure, or
request. However, this does not apply in the following circumstances:
         (a)   disclosures to or requests by a health care provider for
treatment;
         (b)   uses or disclosures made to the individual;
         (c)   uses or disclosures made pursuant to a patient authorization;
         (d)   disclosures made to the Secretary of Health and Human Services,
or his/her duly authorized designee;
         (e)   uses or disclosures that are required by law;
         (f)   uses or disclosures that are required for compliance with
applicable HIPAA Regulation requirements.
   e.   1.   The following shall constitute "Required Disclosures" pursuant to
the HIPAA Regulations and the provisions of this Ordinance:
         (a)   to an individual pursuant to 164.524 or 164.528;
         (b)   when required by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, or
his/her duly authorized designee, to investigate and determine a covered
entity's compliance with HIPAA Regulations.
      2.   When making a required disclosure, or when requesting the required
disclosure of individually identifiable health information from another covered
entity, reasonable efforts shall be made to limit the disclosure of protected
health information to the minimum necessary to satisfy the use, disclosure, or
request. However, this does not apply in the following circumstances:
         (a)   disclosures to or requests by a health care provider for
treatment;
         (b)   uses or disclosures made to the individual;
         (c)   uses or disclosures made pursuant to a patient authorization;
         (d)   disclosures made to the Secretary of Health and Human Services,
or his/her duly authorized designee,
         (e)   uses or disclosures that are required by law;
         (f)   uses or disclosures that are required for compliance with
applicable HIPAA Regulation requirements.
   f.   Any use or disclosure that is not permitted or required constitute an
"Unpermitted Disclosure" pursuant to the HIPAA Regulations and the provisions
of this Ordinance.
   g.   A "Notice of Privacy Rights" shall be issued to all persons to whom the
Town's various Departments provide emergency, and other, medical services, for
whom the Town's various Departments and personnel create and store medical
records pertaining to those services, and for whom the Town's Departments and/
or personnel create billing pertaining to those services.
   h.   The Notice of Privacy Rights to be issued shall contain an advisement
that individuals can execute an Authorization for Release of Medical
Information/ Protected Health Information to a covered or non-covered entity.
Said Authorization shall explain all patient rights regarding the same and
shall include an advisement that the Authorization is valid for one (1) year
from the date of its execution and that it is able to be revoked by the
patient, in writing, at any time.
   i.   Any person and/or entity who contracts with, or otherwise does business
with the Town, pertaining to the provision of emergency, or other, medical
services, creation and storage of records related to the same and creation of
billing related to the same, shall comply with the provisions of the HIPAA
regulations and shall be required to execute Business Associate Agreements, as
defined by applicable HIPAA regulations and containing all required provisions.
   j.   The HIPAA Regulations and the provisions of this Ordinance, passed and
adopted in accordance therewith, shall preempt any State law, rule, regulation
or Ordinance to the contrary; however, in addition, any State law, rule,
regulation or Ordinance that is more stringent than the HIPAA Regulations or
provisions of this Ordinance shall be controlling.
(Ord. No. 1609, §§ 1-10, 3-10-04)
Sec. 2-424 through Sec. 2-429 Reserved for Future Use.
Article 12. Purchasing Regulations.
Division I. Municipal Purchasing Agency.
Sec. 2-430 Purchasing Agency.
   The Schererville Town Council (the "Purchasing Agency") is established as a
Purchasing Agency for the Town of Schererville, Indiana.
(Ord. No. 1428, § 1, 7-8-98)
Sec. 2-431 Powers and Duties.
   The Purchasing Agency shall have all the powers and duties authorized and
permitted under the provisions of Indiana Code, § 5-22, as the same may be
amended from time to time by Ordinance adopted by the Town Council, policies
adopted by the Purchasing Agency, or in amendatory statutory provisions.
Further, the following specific provisions are applicable under such Purchasing
Policy and Procedure of the Town for determining suspension and/or debarment
status of any vendor doing business with the Town Council, namely:
   a.   Suspension and debarment.
      1.   Prior to any purchase for which federal funds and/or federal
assistance is being utilized by the Town, the purchasing agency, or its
delegees, shall examine and verify the status of any vendor participating in or
to be contracted for business with the Town utilizing federal funds and/or
federal assistance for debarment and suspension status to determine whether
such vendor is qualified to participate. The check or verification for
debarment and suspension shall be performed using the EPLS System, or any
similar such system as then currently approved for such purposes. The Town
Department responsible for facilitating, coordinating, and utilizing federal
funds and/or federal assistance will be required to conduct and complete the
EPLS System search, or its approved equivalent, as such procedures and methods
are amended, on all vendors with whom the Town of Schererville intends to
conduct business utilizing such federal funds. Further, the Town Department or
entity responsible shall provide a hard copy proof and verification of each
EPLS, or its approved equivalent search, which will be required to be provided
to the Clerk-Treasurer for maintenance and record keeping in the Office of the
Clerk-Treasurer. It is specifically directed and required that the Town of
Schererville will not conduct any business with any firm, individual, or entity
which has been identified and verified as having been debarred or suspended for
such purposes, in conformance with applicable law, as the same may be amended
from time to time. Further, these policy requirements for determination of
suspension and/or debarment status of any vendor doing business with the Town
of Schererville in which federal funds and/or federal assistance is utilized
shall pertain to "Covered Transactions", which include those government
contracts for goods and services awarded under a non-procurement transaction
(e.g., Grant or Cooperative Agreement) that are expected to equal or exceed
twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00), or meet certain other specified
criteria.
(Ord. No. 1428, § 2, 7-8-98; Ord. No. 1810, 5-9-12)
Sec. 2-432 Purchasing Agent.
   a.   The Purchasing Agency is authorized to designate in writing one (1) or
more individuals to act as a Purchasing Agent for the Town of Schererville,
Indiana.
   b.   The Purchasing Agent shall assume the duties, powers and
responsibilities assigned to a Purchasing Agent and to a Disposing Agent as set
out in Indiana Code, § 36-1-9 and § 36-1-11.
(Ord. No. 1428, §§ 3-4, 7-8-98)
Sec. 2-433 U.S.A. Manufactured Supplies.
   The Town of Schererville, Indiana, shall specify and purchase supplies
manufactured in the United States unless it is determined as follows:
   a.   These supplies are not manufactured in the United States in reasonably
available quantities; or
   b.   The price of the supplies manufactured in the United States exceeds by
an unreasonable amount the price of available and comparable supplies
manufactured outside the United States; or
   c.   The quality of the supplies manufactured in the United States are
substantially less than the quality of comparably-priced available supplies
manufactured outside the United States; or
   d.   The purchase of supplies manufactured in the United States is not in
the public interest.
(Ord. No. 1428, §§ 1-5, 7-8-98)
Sec. 2-434 Central Purchasing Fund.
   a.   There is established for the town, a special fund which shall be known
as the Central Purchasing Fund, established pursuant to the revisions of
Indiana Code §§ 36-1-3-1, et seq., as amended from time to time.
   b.   The newly established Schererville Central Purchasing Department
Central Purchasing Fund shall be funded in conformance with applicable law, as
well as the rules and regulations of the Indiana State Board of Accounts for
such funding. The Central Purchasing Fund of the Town shall be reimbursed by
each Town department when such departments receive officer supplies and other
miscellaneous items purchased by the Central Purchasing Department. Said funds
reimbursed by each department shall be deposited into the Central Purchasing
Fund upon such reimbursement.
   c.   The Town’s Central Purchasing Fund shall be managed and overseen by the
office of the town Clerk-Treasurer and shall be for the specific purpose of
purchasing office supplies and other miscellaneous items as is determined to be
needed by the various departments of the town for future re-purchase by said
individual Town departments.
   d.   The funding for the Central Purchasing Fund shall be from the Town
General Fund in an amount determined annually each year in the budget process
for the purposes for which said Central Purchasing Fund is established.
(Ord. No. 1576 §§ 1-4, 3-12-03)
Sec. 2-435 through Sec. 2-439 Reserved for Future Use.
Division II. Reserved.
Sec. 2-440 through Sec. 2-449 Reserved for Future Use.
